He mentioned remembering you fondly from previous meetings. Would you accompany me? Your presence would mean much - familiar faces aid his memory during recovery."

Evelyn's mood brightened instantly. "He truly remembers me? And favorably?"

"Indeed." Donovan nodded. "Would you join me?"

"Certainly," Evelyn replied, confidence restored.
###Chapter 240

Evelyn understood the gravity of this opportunity. This was her moment to establish ties with the prestigious Kensington family, just as Olivia had done with the Whitmores. Though Evelyn had once criticized Olivia's methods, she now recognized their brilliance. If she could become an honored guest of the Kensingtons, she wondered how Seraphina would dare treat her then.

At these words, Seraphina's panic surged. She grabbed Donovan's arm and pulled him aside. "Donovan, have you lost your mind? You know perfectly well—"

"That's precisely why I did it." Donovan's voice carried heavy disappointment as he rubbed his temples. "I've been too distracted lately to notice your actions. I never imagined you'd go this far. Have you considered how this affects our family? What you're doing is clearly unethical."

Seraphina scoffed. "Ethics? Evelyn seduced Liam away from his wife first. Why can't I play the same game?"

Donovan's headache intensified as disappointment flashed in his eyes. The sweet, well-behaved girl he remembered had become this? He regretted not intervening sooner.

If only Alistair had raised Seraphina with his strict principles. But when her parents returned, they'd immediately reclaimed custody. Over time, her moral compass had become completely distorted.

Donovan's grip tightened on Seraphina's wrist, his voice laced with warning. "Just because others lack morals doesn't mean you should too. I've indulged you too long. Continue down this path, and I'll have no choice but to send you away."

Seraphina met his threat with an icy glare. "My parents and brother would never speak to me like this. You've changed, Donovan. Now all you care about is that missing cousin. Why waste energy on someone who's probably dead?"

Donovan's hand twitched as if to strike. "Say that again and it won't just be words."

Noticing the watching crowd, Seraphina lowered her head in false submission. "I understand."

Donovan saw through the act but let it pass. As he turned to leave, Seraphina stopped him urgently. "Wait—you said Grandfather met Evelyn? And approves of her? Is this true?"

Donovan nodded. "Yes. Someone returned him to us. When I found him, he kept saying he'd found our missing cousin. My investigation suggests Evelyn brought him back. Since Grandfather is the only one who knew our aunt and cousin, if he believes it's her..." He trailed off meaningfully.

Seraphina's eyes widened in disbelief. "But Evelyn has parents! Our aunt and uncle died years ago. There must be some mistake."

The possibility that Evelyn might be their long-lost relative made Seraphina's previous hostility seem ridiculous. Worse, she'd have to address Evelyn as "cousin"—an unbearable thought.

Noticing her turmoil, Donovan added quietly, "I suggest you stop antagonizing Evelyn. If we're reunited and she seeks retribution, I won't interfere."
###Chapter 241

Seraphina Kensington clenched her jaw, frustration radiating from every tense muscle in her body. Yet she could do nothing but watch as Donovan Kensington went to fetch Evelyn Hartley.

Donovan had undoubtedly shared every detail with Evelyn. The smug satisfaction on Evelyn's face was unmistakable, her confidence evident in every calculated step. She even threw Seraphina a triumphant glance that only deepened Seraphina's contempt.

It seemed Evelyn was more than willing to sever all ties with the Hartley family, eagerly abandoning them to curry favor with the Kensingtons. Donovan and Alistair would be fools to embrace Evelyn without seeing through her scheming nature.

Seraphina realized pleading would get her nowhere. As Donovan escorted Evelyn away, a sharp pang of distress gripped her chest. Her eyes glinted with icy determination.

Despite everything, Seraphina took comfort in knowing the gift she'd asked Olivia Sinclair to meticulously prepare would make an impact. She reassured herself that once her health was restored, she wouldn't need to fear people like Donovan and Evelyn anymore. This thought smoothed the tension from her expression.

Meanwhile, Olivia stirred awake, roused by muffled voices outside. Pregnancy had disrupted her sleep patterns, leaving her perpetually exhausted. Even with extended daytime rest, fatigue clung to her like a second skin. Thankfully, Seraphina had kept her promise, ensuring Olivia received proper prenatal care and nutrition.

Lately, Seraphina had been preoccupied with organizing Alistair's birthday celebration, leaving little attention for Olivia. Yet Olivia knew this calm was temporary. She couldn't decipher Seraphina's true intentions.

As Olivia's anxiety grew, the voices outside became clearer.

"Why waste time watching her? Let's just enjoy the party."

"But those are Miss Kensington's orders. If anything happens, we're responsible."

"What's there to worry about? Haven't you seen how cozy she is with Seraphina? She's living better than ever - why would she leave?"

The envy in their tone was palpable.

Hearing them describe her "fortunate" situation, Olivia nearly laughed at the irony. Her current comfort came at the price of future uncertainty. No one knew what dangers lay ahead.

The debate outside continued until, after much deliberation, they finally decided to leave, abandoning their watch over Olivia.

As their footsteps faded, Olivia's pulse quickened. Her chance to escape was finally within reach.

Meanwhile, Donovan led Evelyn to Alistair's private quarters. The elderly man sat at a grand piano, completely absorbed in his playing, his back to the newcomers. Music remained Alistair's sole passion these days.

Evelyn immediately began showering him with praise. "Is that your grandfather? His playing is magnificent. I once knew a professional pianist, but your grandfather's talent far surpasses his." Donovan couldn't help but smirk at her transparent flattery, his voice laced with frost. "That piece was composed by my grandfather specifically for his beloved daughter. Miss Hartley, I'm surprised you claim to have heard it elsewhere."

Realizing her blunder, Evelyn offered an awkward smile and fell silent. Just then, Alistair stopped playing. Only then did Donovan approach his grandfather with a warm smile. "Grandfather, this is Miss Hartley. Does she look familiar to you? Could she be the one you've been searching for?"
###Chapter 242

Evelyn managed to keep her voice barely above a whisper. "Hello, Alistair. I heard we've met before. Do you remember where?"

At that moment, Alistair turned to face Evelyn, his piercing gaze like winter frost. The practiced smile on Evelyn's lips froze instantly, panic flashing in her widened eyes. This couldn't be happening - wasn't this the supposedly deaf elderly man she'd deliberately chosen to mock Olivia because of his disability? How could she have known this very man was Alistair Kensington of the powerful Kensington family?

Suddenly, everything clicked into place for Evelyn, especially why Alistair had told Donovan he was "impressed" with her. After what she'd done to him, how could he not be?

A cold shiver of terror ran down Evelyn's spine. Donovan remained oblivious to her strange reaction, his attention solely focused on his grandfather. Studying Alistair's expression carefully, Donovan only saw the old man giving Evelyn that same detached, icy stare he reserved for complete strangers.

Seeing Alistair's glacial gaze directed at Evelyn, Donovan assumed his grandfather was having another episode. Sobriety had become increasingly rare for Alistair these days. The unpredictability of his condition weighed heavily on Donovan, his eyes growing moist with unshed tears.

Turning to Evelyn, Donovan explained gently, "My grandfather's memory isn't what it used to be. He gets confused sometimes. But don't worry - perhaps if you visit more often, it might help trigger his memories."

Hearing that Alistair struggled with recollection and occasional disorientation, Evelyn felt a wave of relief wash over her, easing the tightness in her chest. Simultaneously, a daring idea took root in her mind. Remembering Liam's indifference and Seraphina's public humiliation, Evelyn vowed silently that one day, she would make them pay.

Clutching this new determination like a lifeline, Evelyn quickly regained her composure. She bowed her head, pretending to dab at non-existent tears. "I understand completely, Donovan. Don't worry - even if it's just a misunderstanding, I'm happy to help in any way. It would be wonderful if Alistair could recover his memories soon."

Then, turning to Alistair with practiced compassion softening her voice, Evelyn continued, "We have met before, Alistair. You once told me I reminded you of your granddaughter. I truly hope you get better soon."

Alistair's gaze drifted into the distance, his expression blank. "Granddaughter... Where is my granddaughter?" he murmured absently.

As Evelyn reached to take Alistair's hand, he unexpectedly pulled away and stood abruptly.

"Seraphina is throwing me a birthday celebration, isn't she? Please, take me there. I want to see everything. It's been too long since we had such a gathering," Alistair said to Donovan.

Donovan gently took his grandfather's arm, guiding him toward the grand hall. Evelyn, refusing to be deterred by the awkward moment, followed closely behind. She recognized the rarity of this opportunity - if played correctly, this could be her golden ticket up the social ladder.

While the Hartley family was certainly wealthy, their fortune paled in comparison to the Kensingtons'. For Evelyn, this wasn't just about money - it was about status, about reclaiming the dignity that had been stripped from her.

Her mind raced with possibilities. After settling Alistair at the banquet table, Donovan discreetly positioned two bodyguards nearby to keep watch. Evelyn seized the chance to sit beside Alistair, ignoring how he seemed to look right through her. She was determined to project an image of intimacy with Alistair, hoping to convince others of their fabricated connection.

Donovan observed Evelyn's maneuvering, his brow furrowing slightly. It was then the head butler interjected with a pointed question that hung heavy in the air: "Is Miss Hartley truly a member of the Kensington family?"
###Chapter 243

Donovan responded with hesitation, "I can't be certain about that. Only my grandfather would know the truth. If he believes Evelyn is related, I'll order a DNA test right away."

Establishing blood relations proved complicated since Donovan's cousin's parents had passed, eliminating the possibility of direct parental verification. This could potentially make the DNA results inconclusive.

Watching Evelyn's excessive flattery, the butler sighed in disappointment. "Even if she wasn't raised as a Kensington, no true descendant would behave so shamelessly. She clearly doesn't value the Hartleys who raised her."

His words held undeniable truth. Even Seraphina, known for her charm, never stooped to such obsequious behavior. This only deepened Donovan's distaste for Evelyn, who valued superficial charm over genuine character.

As Evelyn fawned over Liam, Seraphina watched with growing irritation, her jaw clenched tight. A whisper came from beside her: "Miss Kensington, you must find a way to remove Evelyn from this event. There's no proof of her claims yet. Just look at that smug expression - it's unbearable!"

Seraphina snapped, "Do you think I'm blind? I don't need reminders about the obvious."

Her voice dripped with contempt as she continued, "I've no interest in competing for grandfather's attention. I've prepared a masterpiece as his birthday gift. Even if Evelyn turns out to be family, I'll show her she can't compare."

Thinking of the exquisite artwork Olivia had spent weeks creating, Seraphina's confidence swelled, her chin lifting with pride.

The gift presentation arrived. Seraphina deliberately chose to go last, ensuring her offering would be the grand finale. She wanted this moment to leave an indelible impression on Liam.

When Seraphina unveiled her present, the room fell into awed silence. On an emerald velvet tray sat a breathtakingly carved phoenix, its wings outstretched mid-flight. The craftsmanship was so exquisite that individual feathers appeared to flutter, as if the mythical bird might take flight at any moment.

Such artistry was rare, perhaps beyond even master craftsmen. While Seraphina didn't claim to have made it herself, guests praised her thoughtfulness and dedication. Even Donovan couldn't hide his admiration. "Grandfather has always treasured such pieces. This will bring him immense joy."

With regal poise, Seraphina replied, "For our grandfather, only the best will do. His happiness makes every effort worthwhile."

Her statement came with a pointed glance at Evelyn, throwing down an unspoken gauntlet.

Evelyn had brought a gift for Alistair. But Seraphina's extraordinary present had raised the stakes, forcing Evelyn to reconsider how to make her own offering stand out. Her frustration was palpable.

She seethed that Liam had attended alone without securing her an invitation. Seraphina's obvious interest in him stoked Evelyn's insecurities.

Evelyn's gift - mere health supplements prepared by an assistant - paled in comparison to Seraphina's phoenix.

Donovan noticed Evelyn's discomfort and shook his head slightly at her poor manners. When Liam saw the carving, recognition flashed across his face, his hands trembling slightly. The style was unmistakably Olivia's. But how was this possible?
###Chapter 244

Liam's pulse quickened as he approached the artifact, compelled by an intense need to verify its provenance. Who could possibly have created such a magnificent piece? But just as Liam extended his hand, a sharp cracking sound reverberated through the grand hall.

At first, the assembled guests dismissed it as a trick of the acoustics. Their skepticism turned to stunned silence when the ornate tray holding the delicate crane fractured visibly before their eyes, shattering into countless fragments that skittered across the polished mahogany table.

Moments earlier, Seraphina had been glowing under the shower of compliments, her crimson lips curved in triumph. Now, as the carved masterpiece disintegrated, her expression transformed into a mask of horrified disbelief.

The unspoken question hung heavy in the air - what was this sculpture truly made of? The implications were devastating, not just for the gift's value, but for the Kensington family's carefully cultivated reputation among the elite.

Seizing the moment, Evelyn stepped forward with calculated grace, her voice laced with honeyed malice. "My dear Seraphina, while your gift was certainly eye-catching, its durability leaves much to be desired."

With deliberate slowness, Evelyn retrieved a glittering shard from the wreckage, holding it up to catch the light. Her smirk widened as she examined the fragment. "We all assumed this was genuine jade. How amusing to discover it's merely glass. Though I suppose with such intricate craftsmanship, no one thought to verify the materials?"

The titters of the crowd burned Seraphina's ears like acid. Her delicate features twisted in outrage as she marched forward, fists clenched. "This is impossible! Glass? That's absurd!"

Seraphina had invested a small fortune in this gift. How could Olivia have betrayed her like this?

Evelyn's mocking laughter rang out. "That look of shock tells me everything, darling. Clearly this wasn't your handiwork. Who did you commission? Do share, so the rest of us might avoid similar embarrassment."

Though the guests remained silent, their contemptuous stares spoke volumes. Seraphina's grand gesture had spectacularly backfired. The gift meant to cement her status now lay in ruins. Alistair remained ominously quiet, his thunderous expression more damning than any words.

Donovan's face darkened like a gathering storm as he shot his cousin a withering glare.

For the first time in her privileged life, Seraphina found herself the object of ridicule. Pride had always been her armor, and this public humiliation struck like a dagger to her carefully constructed image.

"You vile creature!" Seraphina's hand flew out before she could stop herself, connecting with Evelyn's cheek in a resounding slap.

Evelyn staggered back, her hand flying to her stinging face, eyes wide with shock.

Seraphina's voice dripped venom. "My grandfather merely remarked you bore a passing resemblance. Don't flatter yourself, you grasping little nobody! Look at you - so desperate to claim kinship you'd abandon your own family. Who do you think you're fooling?"

Evelyn recovered quickly, her retort sharp as a blade. "Coming from the woman shamelessly chasing an engaged man? Tell me, do your finishing schools teach homewrecking alongside etiquette? Or is husband-stealing an extracurricular activity?"

The confrontation escalated with terrifying speed.

Donovan watched the catfight unfold with mounting frustration. This was beneath Seraphina - she was behaving like a common fishwife, not the refined socialite she'd been raised to be. He couldn't help but wonder how different things might have been had she not been influenced by her unscrupulous parents.

What should have been a dignified celebration of Alistair's birthday had descended into farce. Donovan stormed forward, physically separating the two women. "Enough! Have you both taken leave of your senses?"
###Chapter 245

Seraphina Kensington dramatically rubbed her arm, her voice dripping with exaggerated pain. "See? She attacked me first! I was just defending myself. You have to be fair about this!"

Evelyn Hartley shot Seraphina a venomous glare, her eyes narrowing to dangerous slits. The audacity of this woman, batting her eyelashes at Donovan as if she already belonged to the Kensington family!

Donovan's voice rumbled like distant thunder. "That doesn't excuse your actions, Seraphina. You're confined to your room until further notice. Use this time to reflect on your behavior."

Tears shimmered in Seraphina's eyes as her voice cracked with emotion. "This is so unfair! She provoked me first. Who does she think she is, mocking me like that? Donovan, we're family! Are you really going to let this outsider humiliate me?"

Massaging his temples, Donovan felt the beginnings of a migraine. He knew his cousin too well - unless Evelyn suffered consequences for her taunts, Seraphina would escalate this situation beyond repair. While family embarrassment was one thing, if Alistair's fragile memory suffered another shock...

The problem remained - Donovan still couldn't confirm whether Evelyn was actually his long-lost relative. He was trapped in an impossible position.

At that moment, Liam Blackwood approached, positioning himself protectively in front of Evelyn. Seraphina's face flushed crimson with barely contained rage at the sight.

Evelyn, meanwhile, painted on her sweetest smile. "Liam, I knew you'd protect me from this bully."

Ignoring Evelyn completely, Liam fixed his icy gaze on Seraphina. "Miss Kensington, instead of harassing Evelyn, perhaps you should track down whoever sabotaged your gift. They're the real villain here - the one who owes explanations to both you and your grandfather."

Cornered, Seraphina snapped, "I made it myself, alright? I messed up. End of story." Even she recognized how flimsy this excuse sounded.

Donovan's displeasure was evident. "Seraphina, even if you commissioned someone, everyone knows your intentions were good. Now that your surprise is ruined, shouldn't you hold the responsible party accountable?"

"I told you, I made this gift!" Seraphina's voice rose sharply, edged with desperation.

Beneath her fury, a thread of rationality remained. Olivia Sinclair couldn't be exposed - not yet. If anyone recognized Olivia, everything would collapse. For now, Olivia had to stay hidden.

Seraphina's eyes darkened with cold vengeance. She'd make Olivia pay for this humiliation - but later. Much later. Her lips twisted in a silent snarl, rage coiling inside her like a serpent ready to strike.

Suddenly, Donovan had a startling realization. The person he'd been searching for might have crafted this very object. His thoughtful gaze shifted to Liam.

In a flash, Liam seized Seraphina's wrist. She gasped at the unexpected contact, meeting eyes as cold as winter steel.

"Who really made this?" Liam demanded, his voice laced with quiet menace.

A tremor of fear ran through Seraphina. There was no mistaking the threat in Liam's tone. "Mr. Blackwood," she stammered, "I already told you - I made it. Why won't you believe me?"
###Chapter 246

The air crackled with tension as Evelyn stepped forward. "Liam, please," she said softly, placing a gentle hand on his arm. "Don't cause a scene because of me. I'm certain Miss Kensington regrets her actions. I'm willing to forgive her."

Seraphina shot Evelyn a look so venomous it could have poisoned the champagne. She struggled against Liam's iron grip, her face flushed with indignation. "Mr. Blackwood, I'm feeling unwell. I need to rest. Release me this instant!"

Donovan cleared his throat awkwardly, his voice strained. "Mr. Blackwood, this is a family matter. It doesn't concern you."

Liam froze, his eyes darkening with suspicion. Slowly, he released Seraphina's wrist. His piercing gaze swept over Donovan and Seraphina, a cold realization dawning in his gut.

A terrifying thought struck Liam like lightning. Olivia might be hidden among the Kensingtons. But how could she possibly have ended up with that family?

The question hung heavy in the air, a seed of doubt Liam immediately wished he hadn't planted. Did Donovan know anything about this?

Panic clawed at Liam's chest. He shouldn't have involved Donovan in this mess. But back then, with no other options, he'd seen no alternative.

Frustrated, Liam asked Evelyn, who was still quietly weeping, to leave first.

As Sebastian escorted Evelyn away through the murmuring crowd, Liam turned to depart. But then - movement. A blur of color caught his eye. A woman was pushing desperately through the sea of guests, her face etched with determination.

The woman rushed toward Donovan, dropping to her knees right before him. The sudden action silenced the crowd instantly, all eyes locking onto the kneeling figure.

Liam spun around, his breath catching in his throat as recognition hit him like a freight train.

Seraphina's mouth fell open when she saw Olivia collapse to her knees before Donovan. Donovan recovered first, quickly instructing his men to take Alistair away while he handled this unexpected situation.

Unable to speak, Olivia reached into her pocket and produced a carefully folded note. In shaky handwriting, she described being a victim of human trafficking, brought to the Kensington family against her will. She pleaded for freedom, explaining how she and her unborn child were being held captive in terrible conditions. The words painted a picture of desperation that made several guests gasp.

Olivia was risking everything. If fortune smiled upon her and there was even one compassionate soul among the Kensingtons, she might escape this nightmare. Even if her gamble failed, she reasoned they wouldn't dare harm her with so many witnesses. Seraphina's grand celebration had unwittingly provided the perfect stage for her plea.

Moreover, Olivia clung to the slim hope that some guests might be connected to the Bennetts or Whitmores - families who might intervene on her behalf.

Originally, Olivia hadn't planned to burst into the party. She'd deliberately given Seraphina an inferior gift, expecting to be banished from the private rooms. But she'd underestimated Seraphina's cunning. The woman might act like a spoiled brat, but she was sharper than she appeared.

Thankfully, Olivia had spent days playing the perfect victim, lulling Seraphina's guards into complacency. Their lowered vigilance had given her this single chance.

Olivia's silent plea contained horrifying revelations. A pregnant woman, unable to speak, trafficked into a powerful family and held captive. The crowd began buzzing with shocked whispers.

"My God! The scandals these wealthy families hide! How can they be so cruel?"

"Doesn't Eldermere have laws? How is this possible in this day and age?"

The murmurs grew louder, spreading through the glittering crowd like wildfire. Donovan's face darkened as he scanned the note, his expression unreadable. Liam stood frozen, torn between rushing to Olivia's side and maintaining his cover.

Seraphina's cheeks burned crimson with fury. "This is absurd!" she spat. "Someone remove this madwoman at once!"

But no one moved. The weight of Olivia's accusation hung heavy in the opulent ballroom, turning the celebration into something far more sinister. The Kensingtons' perfect facade had cracked, and everyone could see the ugliness beneath.
###Chapter 247

The whispers spread like wildfire through the crowd. "Haven't you heard? The Kensingtons from Westhaven are practically royalty there. Their fortune protects them from consequences, so this doesn't surprise me at all."

Seraphina's face turned ashen, her entire body shaking with barely contained fury. Her sharp gaze swept across the gathering, but her usual entourage was conspicuously absent.

Donovan's expression darkened. He'd known Seraphina had detained a woman, but never imagined she'd stoop to such cruelty. While his cousin often escaped accountability, this time she'd gone too far. Had she completely lost her mind?

But clearly she suffers from mental instability. Don't believe me? Call the authorities to investigate! In fact, I've treated her like royalty - personal nutritionists, daily massages. Why would I go to such lengths if my intentions weren't pure?"

Olivia's mouth fell open, her complexion draining to ghostly white. Her carefully planned exposure had spectacularly backfired.

The crowd's sympathy shifted instantly.

"Just a misunderstanding after all!"

"I knew Lady Kensington would never do such things! How cruel to manipulate such generosity!"

Natalie strained on tiptoes behind the throng, desperate to see the commotion. When she couldn't push through, she grabbed a bystander's sleeve. "What's happening? What are they saying?"

The man sneered in disgust. "Nothing important. Lady Kensington took in some mute pregnant woman who's now biting the hand that feeds her. Can you imagine? Accusing her benefactor! And the poor thing's expecting!"

Natalie's eyes widened in shock. Mute and pregnant - it had to be Olivia. Without hesitation, she began shoving through the crowd. "Olivia! Olivia!"

Olivia heard Natalie's voice and tried to locate her friend. But Seraphina swiftly seized Olivia's arm, digging her nails deep into the flesh.

Unable to voice her pain, Olivia could only endure silently. She looked pleadingly at Donovan, but he stood frozen in thought, brow furrowed. Olivia's heart plummeted - she felt utterly abandoned.

Then, through the sea of faces, Olivia spotted someone familiar. Liam! He'd been watching her intently from the crowd's edge. When their eyes met, she saw both joy and anguish in his gaze.

Olivia tried moving toward Liam, but he remained rooted in place, jaw clenched as he deliberately looked away. Liam reminded himself to maintain control. Now that he'd found Olivia, there were diplomatic ways to secure her release. But timing was everything - if he acted impulsively now, months of careful planning would be ruined. The final pieces were nearly in place. He couldn't risk everything for one emotional moment, no matter how much he longed to sweep her away.

Seraphina raised her hand as if to comfort Olivia, her face the picture of wounded benevolence. "How could you betray me like this? Have you no conscience? If you truly wish to leave, by all means go. But I wonder how you'll survive without the Kensingtons' protection."
###Chapter 248

Seraphina released Olivia and moved to Alistair's side. Olivia attempted to leave, but an imposing figure blocked her path. The realization struck her - this was a Kensington family gathering, and departure required their explicit consent.

"Donovan," Seraphina whispered urgently, pressing close to her cousin. "I'll confess everything, but we must take her away immediately."

Donovan's expression hardened like tempered steel. "I won't be complicit in your schemes, Seraphina. The woman remains here, under my protection."

A venomous smile curled Seraphina's lips as malice danced in her eyes. "As you wish, cousin. I'll bear the consequences of my mistakes alone."

In truth, Seraphina had already set her plan in motion. The moment Olivia was escorted from the ballroom, the hired mercenaries waiting outside would ensure the problem disappeared permanently. Olivia's death was necessary to preserve Seraphina's reputation.

Once silenced forever, Seraphina intended to flee to Westhaven. By the time Donovan uncovered the truth, it would be far too late for reparations.

Just as Seraphina basked in her imagined triumph, the impossible occurred. With a violent shove, Sebastian sent her sprawling across the marble floor as he emerged from behind the decorative screen.

Olivia's despair deepened, though a spark of defiance remained. Was escape truly impossible? Yet surrender wasn't in her nature.

Sebastian loomed over Olivia, his shadow enveloping her. When their eyes met, recognition flashed across Olivia's face. This distinguished gentleman - wasn't he the confused elderly man from Isabelle's birthday celebration? Her breath caught in surprise.

Today, Sebastian carried himself with regal dignity, his hearing noticeably improved. From the hushed whispers around them, Olivia pieced together his identity - the former Kensington family head, Sebastian Kensington.

Baffled murmurs rippled through the crowd, though Donovan and Seraphina recognized the significance immediately. Vivienne Kensington - their long-lost aunt who had severed ties with the family decades ago, taking her child with her.

Seraphina's teeth sank into her lower lip. Could her grandfather truly believe Olivia was his missing granddaughter?

This dangerous delusion couldn't be allowed to continue. "Donovan," Seraphina hissed, "Grandfather's having another episode. Have him removed immediately while I deal with Olivia. We can't become the laughingstock of high society."
###Chapter 249

The initial shock faded, and Donovan Kensington responded with unexpected composure. "In the Kensington family, only our grandfather and the older generation remember what our aunt looked like. I barely caught a glimpse of her as a child, and you've never seen her at all. There aren't even photos of her or her child in the house. Our grandfather may be unwell, his mind not what it used to be, but his memories of our aunt and cousin have always stayed sharp."

Seraphina Kensington’s unease deepened at his words. Her voice rose involuntarily as she demanded clarification. "What are you saying? Are you implying Olivia is our aunt’s child?"

Her emotions made her forget to lower her voice, and nearby guests overheard. At first, they had been puzzled by Alistair Kensington’s strange behavior, but now the pieces were falling into place.

"Olivia never seemed to have any family connections. She had no relatives in Crestwood, which is probably why the Blackwood family took her in. Her parents and paternal grandparents are gone, but I’ve never heard anything about her maternal grandparents. Honestly, she bears a resemblance to the Kensington children. Don’t you think?" Sebastian Montgomery remarked pointedly, catching Liam Blackwood’s subtle cue.

Liam’s intention was clear. Whether Olivia truly belonged to the Kensington lineage or not, they needed to fuel the rumors to make it believable. Besides, it was Alistair who had recognized her first. If she turned out not to be his granddaughter, the blame wouldn’t fall on her.

More importantly, the Kensingtons held a status far above the Whitmores and Blackwoods. With Alistair’s backing, no one would dare mistreat Olivia again.

Wrapped in Alistair’s embrace, Olivia felt an odd sense of familiarity. She could tell he was utterly convinced she was his granddaughter. Maybe it would be easier to just accept it.

But Olivia couldn’t bring herself to take someone else’s place. Gently, she patted Alistair’s back in comfort before pulling away and signing to him. Her gestures conveyed, "Sir, we’ve met before, and perhaps it’s fate. You think I look familiar, but you might be mistaken."

Olivia had grown up with her parents. Stories about her maternal grandfather’s family were absent from her childhood. All she knew was that they had disapproved of her mother’s marriage to her father, leading to unforgivable actions. Because of that, her parents left with her and never looked back.

Later, when her parents passed away, none of the remaining relatives urged her to reconnect with her maternal grandparents. They remained silent about the past, yet Olivia sensed her family’s inherent kindness. Had her grandparents’ actions not been so severe, her parents would never have cut ties completely.

With resolve hardening in her gaze, Olivia shook her head decisively. Her gestures made it clear—she only wanted to leave, even if it meant letting Seraphina’s misdeeds go unpunished. She trusted Alistair to be reasonable and hoped he would respect her wish.

Tears still blurred Alistair’s vision as he stared at her, undeterred.

"You are Vivienne’s daughter. I’m certain of it. You look just like she did at your age. How could I, your grandfather, be wrong? After all these years, Vivienne still refuses to come home. She must despise me and the Kensington name."

His voice trembled. "Child, my memory may fail me these days, but seeing you brings back a sense of familiarity I can’t ignore. I don’t even need a DNA test to know you’re a Kensington. Please, stay. I want to make amends. I lost Vivienne. I can’t bear the thought of losing you too."

His words hung heavy in the air, leaving Olivia torn between the past she knew and the family she never expected to find.
###Chapter 250

Alistair's aged tears moved Olivia, yet she remained resolute, remembering how her own mother had wept whenever her grandfather was mentioned.

Whether Alistair was her biological grandfather or not, Olivia had no interest in the Kensington family fortune.

Olivia placed a protective hand over her abdomen, gathering her strength to rise. Using sign language, she expressed her gratitude to Alistair. She thanked him for his kindness in allowing her to leave and promised not to hold Seraphina accountable for the younger woman's misdeeds these past weeks.

Seraphina and Olivia continued their silent exchange, each gesture laden with unspoken emotions.

Seraphina was clearly the most agitated among them. She no longer expected Donovan to intervene, telling herself they hadn't even done the paternity test yet - perhaps Alistair was merely confused temporarily. She felt an urgent need to remove Olivia immediately, or the consequences would never end.

With these thoughts racing through her mind, Seraphina swiftly intercepted Olivia as she tried to leave.

"Where do you think you're going? You destroyed my gift, framed me, and now you're deceiving my grandfather! You think you can just walk away? Not a chance!" Seraphina shrieked.

Olivia's icy gaze locked onto Seraphina's, noticing the murderous glint in the other woman's eyes.

A bitter chuckle escaped Olivia's lips. She had been willing to let Seraphina off, but the woman's relentless hostility changed her mind.

Meanwhile, Natalie finally pushed through the crowd to reach the front. Seeing Olivia, she couldn't contain her tears.

It marked the first time Natalie had ever lost her composure in public.

Natalie's concern for Olivia ran deep and constant. No matter what she was doing, thoughts of Olivia dominated her mind, eclipsing everything else.

Knowing Olivia's condition - unable to speak and carrying a child - Natalie believed her friend must be enduring unimaginable hardships. Her contempt for the Whitmore and Blackwood families grew as she considered their empty promises. They had vowed to protect Olivia, yet their inaction proved them unreliable.

Natalie's frustration even extended to her own brother, Daniel, who had failed to provide the support Olivia desperately needed.

Overcome with emotion, Natalie approached Olivia, tears streaming down her face. "Olivia, you've lost so much weight. What's happened to you? It's Seraphina, isn't it? How dare she keep you confined? I'm calling the police right now!"

Caught off guard, Seraphina's eyes widened in shock before she quickly countered, "What nonsense are you spouting? I've already explained - Olivia has been well cared for in my home. How can you call that confinement?"

As this exchange unfolded, Olivia struggled to free her hand from Seraphina's iron grip but failed. With her free hand, Olivia gently wiped away Natalie's tears, offering silent comfort.

Unable to use sign language with one hand restrained, Olivia turned her head and fixed Seraphina with an intense, chilling stare.

The ferocity in Olivia's eyes was a stark departure from her usual quiet demeanor, startling Seraphina. Guilt began creeping into Seraphina's conscience as she remembered Olivia was the pitiful victim of human trafficking.
###Chapter 251

Seraphina's fingers dug into Olivia's arm with bruising force. "You're not leaving until I get answers," she hissed, her voice dripping with venom.

Natalie straightened her spine, her piercing gaze locking onto Seraphina. "Miss Kensington, while the full story remains unclear, one fact is undeniable - Olivia was held against her will. You claim to pity her, yet everyone in Crestwood knows she's Liam's wife and a dear friend of my family. William Hayes himself has publicly sworn to protect her. With such powerful connections, how can you possibly call her pitiful? If she's pitiful, what does that make the rest of us?"

The air crackled with tension as Natalie continued, "Olivia was kidnapped by criminals while visiting Henry Winslow's grave. While I don't suspect the Kensingtons' involvement, if you truly rescued her, why wasn't she taken to authorities or a hospital? Why label her a vagrant instead?" Her voice turned razor-sharp. "What are you hiding? Do you think because Olivia can't speak for herself, you can manipulate the situation?"

Seraphina stood frozen, her lips parted in shock. The irony burned like acid in her throat. Olivia, this seemingly fragile woman who Evelyn had bullied so easily, was actually Liam Blackwood's wife.

A bitter jealousy twisted Seraphina's features. Evelyn had schemed for years to marry Liam and failed, yet this "pitiful" woman had succeeded. Though she finally released Olivia, the murderous glint in Seraphina's eyes promised future retribution when the time was right.

Olivia caught that fleeting but unmistakable look of malice. A cold dread settled in her chest. Would leaving with Natalie bring trouble to the Bennetts?

At this critical moment, Donovan stepped forward with practiced charm. "My deepest apologies," he said smoothly, offering Olivia a conciliatory smile. "My cousin can be... impulsive. But I assure you, she'll learn from this."

His tone turned earnest. "You heard Grandfather call you his granddaughter - a claim I find quite plausible. Given his fragile health, I must insist you stay until he stabilizes. Then we can discuss everything properly." He placed a hand over his heart. "Your safety here is my personal guarantee. Everyone present will bear witness. Should anything happen to you, I accept full responsibility."

Natalie scoffed. "Words are wind without action."

Without hesitation, Donovan summoned his legal team. "We'll draft a binding agreement," he announced. "And since Mr. Blackwood is Olivia's husband, his signature will formalize the terms."

When Liam reviewed the document, his brows shot up. "She must report to you about everyone she meets? You're restricting her basic freedom of association?"

Adjusting his glasses, Donovan countered with a sharp smile. "Mr. Blackwood, this is for your wife's protection. Unlike some, we Kensingtons take family security seriously. Had others been more vigilant, she might never have been abducted."

The unspoken accusation hung heavy in the air as lawyers scurried to finalize the agreement that would chain Olivia to the Kensington estate under the guise of protection.
###Chapter 252

Liam's fingers trembled around the pen, the weight of his actions pressing down on him like an iron cloak. The unspoken accusation cut deeper than any blade - that to most, including perhaps Olivia, he'd become nothing more than an absent, indifferent husband.

Standing beside another woman, his moral compass had shattered beyond repair. He no longer felt deserving of Olivia's presence, nor did he possess the courage to meet her gaze after everything that had transpired.

When their eyes finally locked for the first time in what felt like lifetimes, Liam's gaze burned with a turbulent storm of remorse, yearning, and utter bewilderment. That fleeting moment crackled with unspoken electricity before he schooled his features into practiced indifference.

Olivia caught the briefest glimpse of his inner torment before he masked it. She turned away sharply, teeth sinking into her lower lip hard enough to draw blood, questioning whether she'd imagined the raw emotion in his eyes.

Now she understood with painful clarity how others had manipulated the space between them. There had been moments she'd considered explaining, laying bare her truth. But realization struck like lightning - as the wronged party, the burden of justification shouldn't rest on her shoulders.

Liam's opinions, once her guiding stars, now meant less than dust. As this truth settled in her bones, Olivia felt the last fragile threads of their connection unraveling.

His expression glacial, Liam signed the documents with quick, sharp strokes before passing them to Donovan. As he did, his voice dropped to a dangerous murmur. "I want to know exactly how Olivia ended up in your care."

Donovan accepted the papers with a frown that spoke volumes. "My cousin overstepped, but rest assured she'll face consequences. I located your wife days ago, but dealing with Seraphina requires... delicacy. She's both reckless and paranoid." A ghost of admiration flickered across his face. "Truthfully, it was Olivia's own brilliance that secured her freedom."

Liam nodded, eyes suspiciously bright before he mastered himself. That word - brilliance - echoed like a condemnation. His negligence had forced her to become resourceful.

Emotions churning, Liam spoke again, voice thick with unvoiced regrets. "Regardless... you have my gratitude."

Initially, Donovan had pitied the man before him, recognizing the impossible tangle of his circumstances. But as he considered the broader web involving Liam, Evelyn, and Seraphina, his sympathy evaporated.

"Mr. Blackwood," Donovan said with quiet intensity, "while I've no right to comment on personal matters, hear this - hesitation causes more damage than decisive action. Once you choose, commit without looking back." His gaze sharpened. "No one waits forever."

Liam's fists clenched, frustration and resignation warring across his features. Finally, a weary sigh escaped him, carrying the weight of his impossible position.

"Noted," Liam replied, tone edged with finality. "I'll... consider your words carefully. If nothing changes within five days, I'll release Olivia completely." His next words landed like stones. "But you should know - there's strong evidence Olivia might actually be your cousin."

Memories surfaced of crucial information Henry had shared years prior - that the stature and influence of Olivia's maternal grandfather's family dwarfed even the mighty Blackwood dynasty.
###Chapter 253

Olivia's mother had always been stubborn to a fault. She'd severed ties with her parents over some long-buried family secret, refusing all attempts at reconciliation. This decades-old rift explained why no one from her mother's side had ever come looking for Olivia - which was precisely why Henry had begged Liam to keep this truth hidden.

Liam concluded it was better to wait and see if Olivia's maternal relatives would make the first move. Their complete silence over the years suggested they had no intention of welcoming her back.

What Liam didn't anticipate was that Alistair Kensington's family had actually been searching tirelessly for Olivia. Geographical barriers and limited local connections had thwarted their efforts until now.

Liam's decision to let Olivia stay with the Kensingtons had been temporary. Though they appeared welcoming, he suspected darker motives might be at play.

Donovan wasn't surprised by Liam's words. That first encounter with Olivia had sparked an inexplicable sense of recognition that lingered long after their meeting.

When their eyes met, Donovan was instantly transported back to childhood memories of his aunt, though they'd spent little time together. Alistair's visible excitement upon seeing Olivia only confirmed Donovan's growing certainty about their blood relation.

"Thank you, Liam," Donovan said with genuine appreciation before subtly creating distance between them.

Meanwhile, Seraphina's rage was a living thing, twisting her delicate features into something ugly. But she was powerless to act.

Donovan now held the family reins firmly in his grasp. Seraphina knew one wrong move could give him the excuse he needed to cast her out - a threat that haunted her every waking moment.

Just days ago, Seraphina might have seized the chance to leave with Olivia. But recent humiliations had changed everything. Publicly exposed and embarrassed by Olivia before the entire family, Seraphina found herself temporarily paralyzed - yet still clinging to desperate hope that some escape remained.

Alistair grew increasingly convinced Olivia was his long-lost granddaughter, appearing ready to follow her anywhere. Donovan's protective interest in Olivia only further complicated the family's intricate power dynamics.

Under the weight of numerous envious stares, Olivia felt utterly helpless. While she didn't fully agree with Donovan and Liam's decisions, she understood their strategic necessity. Now marked as Seraphina's enemy, Olivia recognized this difficult path as her only viable option.

As the party wound down and guests departed, the Kensingtons prepared to return to their separate lives. Olivia was leaving - this morning she'd hidden in a kitchen supply van just to get here. Desperate to avoid further attention, Seraphina reluctantly allowed Olivia to share her car.

The journey had been grueling for Olivia. Now she finally had a moment of comfort in the Kensington family car. Donovan assisted Olivia with unexpected gentleness that didn't escape Seraphina's notice, fueling her simmering jealousy.

Celeste Dumont, sensing Seraphina's dark mood, cautiously approached to open the car door. Instead of entering, Seraphina fixed her assistant with an icy, penetrating glare that promised consequences.
###Chapter 254

A shiver ran down Celeste's spine as she met Seraphina's glacial stare, silently cursing the incompetence of her team that had led to this disaster. How hard could it be to watch one mute pregnant woman? Those worthless idiots!

Before Celeste could react, Seraphina's palm connected sharply with her cheek. "Do you have something to confess?" Seraphina hissed, her voice dripping with venomous ice.

Panic seized Celeste as she dropped to her knees, words stumbling from her trembling lips. "Miss Kensington, I take full responsibility for today's failures, but I truly didn't anticipate this outcome. I'll accept any punishment. Though considering your health, it's imperative I continue searching for your heart transplant donor."

Rage and frustration made Seraphina's breath come in short gasps. Seeing her distress, Celeste swiftly produced the medication. After swallowing the pills, Seraphina's fury gradually subsided into cold calculation.

Celeste seized the moment to appeal to reason. "Please, Miss Kensington, calm yourself. Someone as insignificant as me isn't worth disturbing your peace. You can deal with my failures later. Once I've secured a replacement, punish me however you see fit. I'll accept it without complaint."

Seraphina's icy gaze softened marginally, though she remained silent for a long moment. "I'll spare you this time," she finally said, her deceptively soft tone laced with steel. "As for those incompetents, I never want to see them again. Make them disappear by any means necessary."

That musical voice, usually so refined, now carried chilling finality. The brutality of the order would have frozen anyone's blood. Celeste felt no pity for her doomed subordinates - survival in Seraphina's service demanded ruthlessness and cunning.

Just as Celeste began to rise in relief, Seraphina's cold voice stopped her. "In such a hurry? Your failures have ruined my mood. As punishment, you'll crawl back to the house. Understood?"

Celeste paled at the cruel command. "But Miss Kensington, it's nearly half a mile to the estate." Walking that distance would be arduous enough - crawling could cause permanent damage.

Seraphina remained unmoved. "Count yourself lucky this is your only punishment. Would you prefer joining your useless team on their final journey?"

The unspoken threat left no room for argument. Resigned, Celeste began her humiliating journey under the confused stares of passersby. Though Seraphina had booked the entire hotel for her event, staff and delivery personnel still moved about freely.

Onlookers whispered and pointed at the crawling woman, their expressions ranging from concern to morbid curiosity. With each painful movement, Seraphina's mood visibly improved, her lips curling in satisfaction.

Meanwhile, Olivia stepped into the Kensington estate with mixed emotions. Donovan's demeanor toward her had been surprisingly gentle throughout their return journey, offering multiple apologies that shocked her given his position as head of the Kensington family.
###Chapter 255

Olivia remained guarded despite Donovan's kindness, her trust not easily given in her fragile condition. As he escorted her inside, Donovan made certain Olivia was comfortably settled in her quarters, assigning both a personal chef and attendants to see to her needs.

His eyes kept drifting to Olivia's swollen belly during their conversation, his unspoken thoughts hanging heavy between them. Sharp as ever, Olivia could practically hear the pity in his gaze. She knew what people whispered - how her husband had abandoned her while she carried his child, leaving her future uncertain.

Noticing his discomfort, Donovan finally looked away, his posture turning awkward.

Olivia wasn't offended. With calm fingers, she typed out a message on her phone. "Don't worry. I'm accustomed to those looks by now. You're hardly the first."

Her words only deepened Donovan's guilt. His voice softened. "Please consider this your home. Ask for anything you need. And... perhaps visit Alistair occasionally? You're his granddaughter, and he's quite fond of you."

Olivia studied the hopeful glimmer in his eyes before responding carefully. "I doubt I'm who you're searching for, but I appreciate today's kindness. I'll visit Alistair when possible. May you find your cousin soon."

Donovan shook his head gently. "You already know the truth between us. I understand if you can't forgive our family's failures. But Alistair isn't getting younger, and your presence would mean everything. He bears no blame for past wrongs."

His words struck a chord. Though part of her recognized their connection, admitting it aloud felt impossible. Her mother's dying wishes echoed in her mind - the reluctance to return to the Kensington estate that Olivia now shared.

She knew her presence here unsettled certain family members. Yet circumstances left her no choice but to temporarily reside in the grand Kensington manor.

After ensuring Olivia's comfort with meticulous arrangements, Donovan turned to leave, issuing instructions to the butler.

First, he ordered Seraphina's immediate return to Westhaven, eliminating any chance she might harm Olivia again. Then he doubled Olivia's security detail, determined to protect her.

A sudden scream shattered the manor's tranquility, interrupting Donovan's plans for Olivia's peaceful stay.

Frowning, Donovan rushed toward the commotion. Servants had frozen in place, staring at the gates where Celeste, Seraphina's assistant, stood with bloodied knees, barely able to stand.

The whispering servants fell silent at Donovan's approach. Taking in Celeste's gruesome state, his frown deepened. "Have you lost your mind?" he demanded.

Despite her pain, Celeste managed to speak through clenched teeth. "Mr. Kensington, this is all my fault! Please don't blame Miss Kensington. She's ill and needs a transplant desperately."

"The scheme to find a donor through... unsavory means was my idea alone. Miss Kensington merely took pity on Olivia. She never approved my actions. I only wanted to help her!"

Donovan's expression turned glacial. "Do you comprehend the full consequences of taking responsibility for Seraphina? Shall I remind you?" he snapped.

Celeste trembled slightly. She knew exactly what awaited her as the scapegoat - Seraphina had made certain of that through this public humiliation.

Before Donovan could continue, Seraphina interrupted with feigned urgency, stomping her foot for attention. "Donovan! Even if Celeste acted wrongly, it was for my sake. None of you care about my condition as she does!"

Donovan's sharp gaze caught the fleeting smugness in Seraphina's eyes. "Celeste committed a grave offense. As head of this family, I must address it properly," he stated coldly.

Unable to counter his logic, Seraphina dramatically knelt beside Celeste. "You can't punish her! She's been with me since childhood. If you punish her, punish me too!"

The absurdity made Donovan laugh despite the tension.

His resolve remained firm. "I never intended to let you escape consequences. You're confined to your rooms until your departure for Westhaven."

A subtle shift crossed Seraphina's face before she clutched her chest dramatically, feigning collapse.

Ever loyal, Celeste sprang to support the act. "Mr. Kensington, reconsider! Miss Kensington is innocent! With her heart condition, anything could happen during travel. You'd regret it forever!" she pleaded.
###Chapter 256

Donovan Kensington clenched his jaw, his voice dripping with cold determination. "If I recall correctly, she's been begging to return to Westhaven for months. I'm simply granting her wish. Shouldn't she be grateful? Besides, the best medical specialists who treated her before are based there. This is for her own good."

As Donovan laid out his reasoning, Seraphina's performance escalated dramatically. She let out a piercing wail, clutching her chest as if on the verge of collapse, hoping to manipulate Donovan's decision through sheer theatrics. Celeste Dumont, despite her own discomfort, had no choice but to continue supporting Seraphina's exaggerated distress.

Donovan's icy gaze swept over both women before he exhaled wearily. His tone softened marginally as he commanded, "Return to your quarters. I'll inform you of my final decision when I'm ready."

The moment Donovan turned away, Seraphina immediately dropped her act. She shot Celeste a venomous glare, her frustration palpable. "This is all your fault. You're why Donovan isn't buying it."

Celeste bowed her head in submission, her voice trembling with apology. "My deepest apologies, Miss Kensington. I accept full responsibility for my shortcomings."

"Stay kneeling here until I say otherwise," Seraphina snapped before her thoughts turned to Olivia Sinclair, her long-lost cousin who had recently returned to Newport.

The security team immediately alerted Donovan when Seraphina arrived to visit Olivia. After brief consideration, Donovan granted permission but issued strict orders. "Double the guards around Olivia. Protect her at all costs. Report any incidents to me immediately."

"Yes, sir."

Olivia was enjoying a peaceful stroll through the gardens accompanied by her private nurse when she suddenly heard an artificially sweet voice behind her.

"There you are, darling Olivia!" Seraphina called out with exaggerated cheerfulness, her smile never reaching her cold eyes.

Olivia's entire body tensed. Just hearing that voice made her skin crawl. She turned slowly, her expression carefully blank.

Undeterred, Seraphina swept forward and linked arms with Olivia as if they were childhood friends. "Welcome home, cousin! I'm absolutely thrilled you're back. I brought you a present! I do hope you'll adore it."

Olivia's eyes flashed with warning as she forcefully disengaged herself, putting clear distance between them. It astonished her how Seraphina could pretend their bitter history didn't exist, acting as if yesterday's hostilities had never occurred.

Using sign language that was immediately interpreted, Olivia responded sharply. "Seraphina, spare me the act. We both know we're not friends. Consider this your only warning - if you cross me, I will hold you accountable. Since you haven't actually harmed me yet, I'm willing to overlook your past behavior. But stay away from me."

Seraphina merely batted her eyelashes, feigning innocence and hurt. "Are you really rejecting family, Olivia? I've apologized for the past. Can't you give me a chance to make things right? We should at least try to get along for Donovan's sake," she pleaded, her saccharine tone making Olivia's stomach turn.

Olivia's disgust grew as she witnessed Seraphina's transparent performance. With a discreet gesture, she signaled both her nurse and security detail to intervene and create space between them.
###Chapter 257

The bodyguards and nurse hesitated before finally stepping back, creating an uneasy space between the two women. Their retreat was reluctant, their protective instincts warring with their orders.

They didn't go far. From a careful distance, the security team kept vigilant eyes on Olivia and Seraphina. Their primary concern was ensuring the pregnant woman remained unharmed.

The moment they were alone, Seraphina's mask slipped. Her saccharine smile twisted into something venomous. The transformation was startling.

Glancing around with theatrical exaggeration, Seraphina sneered. "Ever since you showed up, Donovan barely glances my way. Imagine his reaction when he discovers you're not actually his cousin?"

Olivia arched one delicate eyebrow. Her fingers danced across her phone screen with practiced ease. "Is that supposed to be a threat?"

A cruel smirk played on Seraphina's lips. "Don't play dumb. You manipulated both Donovan and Alistair into believing you're their long-lost relative just to escape my control, didn't you?" She leaned closer, her voice dropping to a venomous whisper. "Alistair's memory isn't what it used to be - he's mistaken others for his granddaughter before. And Donovan? His blind respect for the old man made him an easy mark. You saw your opportunity and took it. That birthday gift scheme was particularly clever."

Olivia nearly choked on the absurdity of these baseless accusations. The irony was almost laughable.

A realization struck Olivia then - Seraphina hadn't been present during Donovan's private conversation with her. She didn't know Donovan had asked Olivia to stay regardless of blood relations, purely to humor Alistair's fragile belief.

This ignorance led Seraphina to construct an elaborate conspiracy theory where Olivia was the master manipulator.

In a twisted way, part of Seraphina's accusation held truth. Olivia had indeed researched Alistair's preferences before crafting his birthday present. But the motives behind this action were worlds apart from Seraphina's paranoid assumptions.

Interpreting Olivia's silence as confirmation, Seraphina's eyes glittered with malicious triumph. She seized Olivia's wrist with surprising strength. "If I were you, I wouldn't have the audacity to stay. The sheer shamelessness..." Her grip tightened. "Have your baby and disappear. Or I'll make you regret ever setting foot in Kensington Manor."

Olivia wrenched her arm free with a sharp motion. Her glacial stare could have frozen lava as she typed her response: "No need for concern. I'll be gone soon enough."

Staying permanently had never been part of Olivia's plans, regardless of her connection to the Kensingtons.

Seraphina's posture straightened with smug satisfaction, misinterpreting Olivia's words as surrender. With a contemptuous sniff, she strode away, the very picture of victorious arrogance.

Their heated exchange remained private, unnoticed by the watchful bodyguards stationed just out of earshot.

When Donovan received the report from his subordinate, his brow furrowed in concern.

###Chapter 258

"That's just like Seraphina," Donovan remarked with a sigh. "She hasn't harmed Olivia yet, so let's not provoke her. If she realizes we're monitoring her, she might act recklessly. At any rate, she'll be leaving soon. Everything's been arranged. For now, focus on keeping Olivia safe."

No sooner had Donovan spoken than the butler entered, looking slightly flustered. "Mr. Kensington, Mrs. Blackwood has a visitor."

"Is it one of Olivia's friends? Did he identify himself?" Donovan inquired, his curiosity piqued.

The butler nodded. "He introduced himself as Liam Blackwood."

Donovan's eyebrows shot up in surprise. "What could he possibly want?" he muttered. "Does he question my arrangements, or is he planning to reveal something to Olivia?"

Donovan assumed Liam was the scoundrel who'd abandoned his pregnant wife for another woman.

While Donovan respected Liam's sharp business acumen and impressive achievements, he strongly disapproved of the man's personal choices.

His first instinct was to send Liam away immediately. Yet after a moment's consideration, he reconsidered.

"Ask Olivia if she wishes to see him. If she agrees, arrange a suitable meeting place."

"Right away, sir," the butler responded with a polite bow.

Olivia was taken aback when informed of Liam's unexpected visit. She'd assumed he would simply mail the divorce papers, never expecting him to appear in person. Was he here to witness her signing them himself? That must be it - he probably wanted to finalize their separation quickly so he could marry Evelyn without delay.

Olivia gave a firm nod. She too wanted closure on their unhappy marriage.

Five minutes later, Liam was escorted to her sitting room. He looked as striking as ever, his composed demeanor giving nothing away, his dark eyes as unreadable as always.

As Liam entered, Olivia rose gracefully and acknowledged him with a slight nod.

After their confrontation yesterday, she found herself surprisingly composed in his presence.

Approaching cautiously, Liam fought to conceal his inner turmoil, deliberately choosing a chair at a respectful distance.

"How's the baby? Everything progressing well?" Liam asked, his voice uncharacteristically gentle.

Olivia nodded, her hand instinctively moving to cradle her swelling belly. The tiny flutters and kicks had become more pronounced lately - a miraculous sensation that never failed to awe her.

Previously, she'd only seen her child during ultrasound appointments. Now she could feel every movement through her skin, a constant reminder of the life growing within her.

Liam's smile turned bittersweet as he clenched and unclenched his fists in quiet resignation.

"I know the child is mine. I was a fool before," Liam admitted.

Sebastian had revealed the entire truth to Liam after Olivia disappeared.

There had been a brief moment when Liam realized the baby Olivia carried was his. But fate intervened - he collapsed before making amends, that crucial memory erased by the drugs in his system.

Now that Liam had traced the source of the substances used against him, his enemies could no longer manipulate him with their chemical weapons.
###Chapter 259

As the drug's effects gradually faded, Liam began recovering fragments of buried memories.

Occasionally, Liam wondered how different life might have been if he hadn't collapsed that fateful day. Perhaps he and Olivia would still be together, raising their child in peaceful happiness. Being a devoted father and loving husband had always been his deepest aspiration.

Yet Liam understood with painful clarity that Olivia would have faced countless dangers had he remained conscious. His temporary oblivion about fathering her child had been their greatest protection, misleading his enemies completely.

Back then, with threats lurking in every shadow, he could barely protect himself - let alone shield Olivia.

Though every fiber of his being longed to keep Olivia close, Liam knew exposing her to danger was unforgivable. As head of the Blackwood family, he bore the responsibility of resolving generational conflicts, even when it meant becoming an unwitting target.

Thinking of Olivia's safety, Liam drew a steadying breath, wrestling his turbulent emotions under control.

At that moment, Olivia stepped forward and took Liam's hand.

His heart hammered violently against his ribs, his carefully constructed composure threatening to shatter. Yet he maintained an impassive mask, though turmoil raged within.

Olivia seemed unaffected by his apparent detachment. Gently, she guided his hand to rest on her rounded belly.

A sharp pang of sorrow pierced Olivia's heart, resurrecting painful memories. Yet simultaneously, an odd sense of closure washed over her - as if this might be their final meeting.

Olivia grappled with conflicting emotions, realizing her personal grievances couldn't overshadow the greater truth. This wasn't just about her baby - Liam was the father.

As Olivia pressed Liam's palm against her abdomen, overwhelming emotion crashed over him. The faint but steady pulse of their unborn child resonated through his fingertips.

The profound moment nearly undid Liam. Abruptly, he withdrew his hand and turned away, hiding his vulnerability.

"From today onward, this child is solely your responsibility," Liam declared, his harsh tone belying his earlier emotion. "Boy or girl, keep them far from the Blackwood name."

Though cruel-sounding, Liam's command stemmed from protective instincts, shielding their child from potential family conflicts.

Olivia responded with an understanding smile and quiet nod.

Liam then produced several crumpled papers from his pocket - divorce documents.

Normally fastidious, Liam had unconsciously crushed these papers repeatedly during his journey, betraying his inner conflict.

Avoiding Olivia's gaze, he spoke rapidly, fighting to control his voice. "Read carefully before signing."

He added tersely, "Before Henry passed, he left something for you. Margaret took it, but it'll be returned after the divorce. May you and the child find happiness. Just... don't come back."

Olivia's eyes dropped to the agreement, noting Liam's signature already gracing the page.

Emotions swirled violently as she studied the document.

After years of entanglement, their impending separation evoked conflicting relief and sorrow.

Part of Olivia had secretly believed they might never actually divorce.

Yet here it was - the official end transforming them into perfect strangers.

A slight lip twitch betrayed Olivia's lingering pain, though less intense than before.

She accepted the documents, her pen scratching decisively across the paper.

When Olivia returned the signed agreement, Liam seemed momentarily disoriented.

"You signed too quickly," he managed, voice thick. "Aren't you going to review the terms?"

Olivia shook her head fluidly, conveying absolute trust. She doubted Liam would manipulate conditions to trap her.

While Liam had made mistakes and occasionally overstepped, he'd always been transparent with her.

Reflecting on their turbulent relationship, Olivia realized what she'd once perceived as Liam's overbearing actions stemmed from her own belief in their unbreakable bond. Without emotional ties, his behavior wouldn't have seemed excessive. This understanding came too late.

As Liam prepared to leave, Olivia mustered a bright smile and waved, masking her heart's finality with cheerful pretense.

Liam caught her smile briefly before averting his eyes, clutching the signed papers tightly as he hurried away.

Exiting, Liam immediately noticed several vigilant bodyguards surrounding the area - unmistakably Donovan's men.

At that moment, Sebastian was attempting entry but being restrained by the guards.
###Chapter 260

Frustration burned in Sebastian's chest as he confronted the security team. "I saw you let Mr. Kensington through. Why am I being denied entry? This is blatant favoritism!"

The head guard remained impassive, his voice professional yet firm. "Our orders come directly from the top, sir. I suggest you take this up with management."

Liam approached swiftly, placing a restraining hand on Sebastian's arm before the situation escalated.

Sebastian's jaw clenched, his displeasure evident in every tense line of his body.

Once they'd moved away from earshot, Sebastian couldn't contain his frustration. "Mr. Blackwood, you shouldn't have made those concessions. It's obvious Donovan has reservations about you."

Liam's gaze remained fixed on some distant point as he responded in measured tones. "Donovan's wariness works in our favor. It means he's vigilant - exactly what Olivia needs for protection. His caution with me ensures he'll be doubly careful with others." A faint smile touched his lips. "Besides, public commitments from a Kensington aren't easily retracted."

Sebastian frowned. "But what if she's not actually related to the Kensingtons?"

Liam shook his head dismissively. "Even if that were true, he wouldn't reverse course now. The Kensington family needs stability, and Olivia provides that." His voice took on a bitter edge. "They're not like the Blackwoods. They actually care about their people."

Sebastian caught the unspoken comparison, exhaling heavily.

The implication hung between them - the Blackwood family's notorious emotional detachment, their cold corporate mentality.

Breaking the heavy silence, Liam suddenly commanded, "To the hospital."

Sebastian nodded briskly, opening the car door with practiced efficiency.

The scene at Mercy Hospital's VIP wing was tense when they arrived. The Kensington family stood clustered outside the critical care unit, their expressions grim. Evelyn appeared particularly distraught.

Richard and Victor were already present, the air thick with unspoken accusations.

Liam's calm entrance created an immediate contrast to the charged atmosphere.

Richard rounded on him immediately, his voice shaking with barely contained rage. "Mother nearly died in that accident! Where were you? How can you stand there looking so unaffected? Don't you care at all?"

At this, Victor stepped forward.

The left side of Victor's face remained hidden behind a medical mask, giving him an unsettling, asymmetrical appearance. His visible features were handsome but set in grim lines.

"Richard, let's remain hopeful. Mrs. Winslow is strong." Though Victor's words seemed conciliatory, his gaze fixed accusingly on Liam. "Though I must say, Liam, your demeanor is... remarkably composed for a son visiting his critically ill mother."

Before Liam could respond, Evelyn jumped to his defense. "That's not fair! Liam's been making arrangements this whole time. Just because he's not weeping in the hallway doesn't mean he's not concerned."

Liam nodded calmly. "Quite right. I've been making extensive preparations."

At Liam's subtle gesture, Sebastian produced several items from his briefcase - funeral urns, memorial cards, and other end-of-life arrangements.

The hospital corridor fell into stunned silence.
###Chapter 261

Richard's initial shock quickly morphed into white-hot fury. "Liam! What kind of twisted game are you playing? Have you been counting down the days until our mother's death? She's fighting for her life in that hospital bed. Have you no shame?" His hands trembled at his sides, veins bulging in his neck.

Liam's face turned to stone, his piercing gaze glacial. "Cut the theatrics. We both know why you're here. I've seen through your little charade since Margaret's so-called accident. Why bother pretending now?"

Cornered, Richard lashed out like a wounded animal. "You're delusional! That accident happened barely three blocks from your penthouse. Who wouldn't suspect you? And now you're not just wishing her dead, but trying to blame me? The audacity!"

A cold smirk played on Liam's lips. "Three blocks, you say? Fascinating precision. Weren't the security cameras mysteriously disabled that day? How then, dear brother, do you know the exact location?"

Richard's mouth opened and closed like a fish out of water, his face flushing crimson.

Victor sighed inwardly, mentally cataloging Richard's incompetence.

The silence stretched painfully as Richard struggled to form a coherent response, his earlier bravado crumbling.

Watching the exchange unfold, Victor realized their carefully laid plans were unraveling. With a subtle tilt of his head, he signaled Evelyn to initiate their contingency plan.

To his utter disbelief, Evelyn deliberately turned away, pretending not to notice his cue.

Victor's expression darkened like a gathering storm.

The air grew thick with tension, charged like the moment before lightning strikes.

Catherine's smooth voice sliced through the silence. "This isn't right, Liam. Richard has barely left Margaret's bedside these past days. We all know how devoted he is. Your accusations are cruel."

Liam's smirk deepened as his gaze locked onto Catherine. "Ah, Catherine. I'd almost forgotten you were here. Now that you've spoken up, I have a question for you too."

The unspoken threat in his eyes made Catherine's blood run cold.

Her mind raced through every secret, every deception. Had he discovered her role in misleading him about Olivia's pregnancy? But no, he wouldn't be this composed if he knew. Then what? What other skeleton had he dragged from her closet?

Her manicured nails dug into her palms as she braced for the blow.

At that precise moment, a harried doctor rushed into the waiting area, his face grave. "Is the Winslow family here?"

All eyes snapped toward him, the earlier confrontation momentarily forgotten.

Richard's face crumpled with what appeared to be genuine distress, tears welling in his eyes. "Doctor! How's my mother? Please tell me there's improvement!"

Liam remained impassive, observing his brother's performance with detached amusement. Never in thirty-five years had Richard shown such concern for their mother.

The doctor adjusted his glasses, his expression unreadable.

The tension in the room became almost palpable.

Then—

The heart monitor's flatline tone pierced through the hospital corridor like a death knell.
###Chapter 262

The physician placed a comforting hand on Richard's shoulder. "Your mother's condition is temporarily stable, but her prognosis remains uncertain. If there are any final words you wish to share, this would be the appropriate time. The vehicular collision caused catastrophic injuries, and she could expire at any moment."

Before the doctor finished speaking, a woman's choked sob pierced the tense silence.

Catherine Winslow stood weeping uncontrollably, her shoulders shaking with each ragged breath.

Richard's face mirrored his wife's apparent grief, every muscle taut with visible distress.

The weight of impending loss hung heavy in the sterile hospital corridor - except for one person.

Noticing the disapproving glances directed at Liam, Sebastian leaned closer and murmured, "Sir, perhaps some visible concern would be prudent?"

Liam's lips twisted into a sardonic smile as he whispered back, "Why perform grief when we all know the truth? They've scheduled Mother's demise for today regardless of her actual condition. Surely you don't doubt this?"

Sebastian bowed his head in silent acknowledgment.

Liam's icy gaze swept across the assembled relatives before issuing quiet orders. "Execute the contingency. Clean and thorough."

"Understood." Sebastian melted into the background as the family continued their theatrical mourning.

Richard wiped his eyes dramatically. "I'll handle this. As firstborn, any final wishes belong to me alone."

Liam intercepted his brother's movement toward Margaret's private room. "Don't be absurd, Richard. We share the same blood. Mother would want us both present."

Richard's jaw clenched. "You've barely visited during her entire hospitalization! Now at this critical hour, you suddenly appear? What's your true agenda?"

Liam countered smoothly, "My absence maintained Blackwood Enterprises. Shall we trade places? You manage the corporation while I play devoted son?"

Richard's expression brightened momentarily at the suggestion.

Before he could respond, an elderly Winslow cousin interjected, "Richard, you should enter together."

Richard's smile froze. Rage flickered behind his eyes, but he restrained himself - this distant relative still commanded respect.

His carefully orchestrated audience of relatives now worked against him. Though they disapproved of Liam's apparent indifference, none wished to see the incompetent Richard helm the family empire.

Standing apart, Victor Blackwood observed this dynamic with new understanding. He stroked his chin, reassessing his strategy.

After prolonged stalemate, Liam took decisive action. With one final dismissive glance at Richard, he strode into Margaret's room.

Richard moved to follow but found his path blocked by security. "What is the meaning of this?" he demanded.

The lead guard offered a polite but firm smile. "Mr. Blackwood requests privacy with his mother. Please wait your turn."

Richard's face darkened with fury. "What secrets is my brother hiding now?"
###Chapter 263

While Richard caused a commotion in the hallway, Liam remained unfazed.

Perched beside Margaret's hospital bed, Liam studied her with quiet intensity. "Mother?" His voice was featherlight, barely disturbing the sterile air.

At the sound, Margaret turned her head with deliberate slowness. Her whisper carried venom. "Finally gracing me with your presence? Come to witness my final moments?"

Liam's expression remained unreadable. "You've still got enough fire to insult me. The doctors clearly exaggerated your condition." His fingers tapped rhythmically against the armrest. "Let me guess - you've been mobile for days. Richard fabricated this coma story to manipulate me into visiting."

A shadow flickered across Margaret's face before vanishing behind her practiced mask of indignation. "Richard acted out of concern! Unlike you, abandoning your own mother for that scheming little—"

"Actually," Liam interrupted smoothly, "Richard specifically warned me against visiting. Claimed my presence might...aggravate your condition."
