Liam merely shot her an icy glare before turning away. Olivia had no interest in engaging with her either.

Isabelle rolled her eyes dramatically. "He only takes it off around my mother because he trusts her completely," she said pointedly. "You'd never see his face otherwise." The words struck Margaret like a physical blow. Despite her young age, Isabelle was far from naive.

Alistair returned, and Isabelle had been eagerly awaiting this moment. Yet he ignored everyone. Though Olivia tried to comfort her daughter, Isabelle remained despondent. She blamed Margaret for locking Alistair away and drugging him into forgetting them.

Understanding the implication, Margaret sneered viciously, "Don't get too comfortable. I doubt your mother and Liam will last. You'll always be fatherless."

Bang! Olivia slammed her spoon down with such force the table shook. Her piercing gaze locked onto Margaret. "Do you truly believe I won't touch you just because you're controlling my grandfather?"

Panicked, Margaret tried to reach Alistair for protection. But bodyguards blocked her path. Alistair continued eating, completely indifferent to Margaret's plight. In his altered state, having Margaret nearby was all that mattered.

Margaret's face flushed crimson with rage before draining of all color. With no other choice, she dropped to her knees and apologized to Isabelle. When she rose, her eyes burned with undisguised hatred for the three of them.

That night, both Olivia and Isabelle were struck with excruciating stomach pains. Liam, who hadn't left yet, rushed to their side when he got the news. Seeing their ashen faces, he felt genuine panic for the first time in his life. But he quickly composed himself and ordered Winston to get them to Mercy Hospital immediately.

As they prepared to leave, determination flashed in Liam's eyes. He called Sebastian, instructing him to come at once and keep watch over Margaret.

Thanks to their swift arrival at the hospital, Olivia and Isabelle would recover with treatment. But Olivia's pregnancy complicated matters—she nearly miscarried. Liam had suspected she was pregnant when he saw her at the hospital earlier. At the time, she'd seemed despondent and unwilling to see him.

Assuming she wanted to terminate the pregnancy, Liam had felt a pang of sorrow but respected her decision. Now, as Olivia lay drenched in sweat, her face ghostly pale, she clung to Liam's hand and murmured deliriously, "My baby...save my baby..."

Liam's composure cracked. "You...you want to keep it?" he asked, voice thick with emotion.
###Chapter 518

Olivia's eyelids fluttered shut. Oblivious to her earlier exchange with Liam, her fingers instinctively curled into the fabric covering her abdomen. "This is my child. I must protect it."

Tears welled in Liam's eyes. Just then, the physician entered. Liam swiftly schooled his expression, though the tremor in his voice betrayed his anguish. "She's expecting. Do whatever it takes to save her. If the baby can't be saved... so be it. I'll bear the responsibility."

The doctor gave a solemn nod. Fortunately, Olivia had ingested only a trace of the toxin and had undergone immediate gastric lavage. Both mother and child were out of immediate danger.

The physician kept his tone grave. "The fetus is stable for now, but the toxin exposure remains a concern. Even at this early stage, there could be lasting effects. The mother must be informed so she's prepared for any complications."

Liam's lips twisted into a humorless smile. "Perhaps you should be the one to tell her when she wakes. I'm... not the right person to deliver that news."

The doctor frowned. "I assumed you were her—"

Liam cut him off with a shake of his head. "No. And don't mention my presence. She wouldn't welcome it."

After Liam's departure, the nurses exchanged hushed whispers.

"Even with that mask, you could tell he's devastatingly handsome. The way he looked at her—like she was his entire world."

"Did you see how his hands shook? When he first rushed in, his shirt was soaked through with sweat. And when the doctor mentioned risks to the baby? I thought he might collapse."

Unbeknownst to them, Olivia caught fragments of their conversation through the fog of sedation. A desperate curiosity about this mysterious man tugged at her, but exhaustion dragged her back under before she could speak.

Time blurred. When consciousness next claimed Olivia, darkness still cloaked the hospital room. Medical staff moved in quiet efficiency, and Sebastian stood vigil at her bedside.

Panic surged through Olivia the moment coherence returned. "Where's Isabelle?" Her voice cracked as she fought to throw off the sheets, her body weak but determined to search for her daughter. Sebastian hurried to reassure her. "Miss Kensington, there's no need for alarm. Your daughter is not only safe—she's thriving. She's awake, full of energy, and the doctors even recommended she have some broth."

Olivia exhaled in relief. Then, her hand drifted to her stomach, her pulse stuttering with dread. Was the baby still there? Liam must have known.

Noticing her distress, Sebastian cleared his throat. "Mr. Blackwood believes the decision rests entirely with you as the mother. He's... overjoyed, but he hasn't forgotten Mr. Kensington's warnings about Isabelle's traumatic birth. He doesn't want you to endure that agony again."

Olivia's lashes lifted in surprise. She had expected Liam to demand the child be kept at all costs. A flicker of something unreadable passed through her eyes before she changed the subject. "Where is Liam now? Have we uncovered who's responsible?"

###Chapter 519

Sebastian Montgomery gave a solemn nod, stepping closer with lowered voice. "It was Margaret. Do you still have energy left? She went after both you and Isabelle. Mr. Blackwood demanded we handle her mercilessly, but I believe he's gone too far."

Before Sebastian's words fully dissipated, Olivia Sinclair was already struggling to sit up. "Take me there," she demanded urgently.

Outside Mercy Hospital, a sleek limousine idled near the entrance. Inside, Margaret Sinclair lay crumpled on the floor, her body a canvas of crimson stains. Only the faint movement of her chest betrayed any sign of life. Liam Blackwood sat beside her, his gaze burning with lethal intensity. Though he'd already exacted punishment, his fury remained unquenched. The memory of Olivia and Isabelle being rushed into the emergency room - gasping, pale-faced - still clawed at his heart.

Margaret was a cornered serpent, unpredictable and deadly. Alive, she remained a perpetual threat, always coiled to strike or escape, endangering others even in captivity. Sensing her precarious position, Margaret taunted Liam through bloodied lips. "Go ahead, kill me. Murder carries consequences, darling. Do it, and you'll never walk openly with Olivia again. It'll haunt little Isabelle too. My death would poison your future with them. Doesn't that sound... poetic?"

Her barbed words found their mark. Liam's dark eyes narrowed like a raptor's, his voice glacial as he commanded his men. "Didn't you hear her request? Dispose of her. Dump the body at sea!"

"Liam!" The command froze as Olivia appeared, leaning heavily on Sebastian. Clad in a hospital gown, her pallor matched the sterile walls, fragility evident in every movement. At her appearance, Liam's demeanor shifted instantly. The storm in his eyes calmed as he rushed to support her.

Liam shot Sebastian a venomous glare. "Sebastian, do you wish to join her?"

Sebastian averted his gaze silently. Olivia grasped Liam's hand with surprising strength. Normally resistant to showing weakness around him, her current state left no choice but to lean into his embrace.

"Liam, can we discuss this?" Olivia's voice carried no command, only vulnerable exhaustion.

Liam felt the unnatural chill of her fingers, concern spiking. Without hesitation, he shrugged off his tailored jacket, wrapping it around her shoulders. His distinctive scent enveloped her like a protective shield, the immediate proximity seeming to steady Olivia's nerves. A forced cough shattered the moment. "I'm stronger than I look," she insisted. "But I'm serious about this. You can't kill Margaret or continue harming her. We need to end this cycle. My carelessness gave her the opening to hurt me and our daughter. Think of Isabelle's future."

Liam trembled with barely contained rage, a tempest barely leashed by Olivia's calming presence. His gaze flicked to Margaret, whose defiant smirk remained. "But Olivia, I can't risk her hurting you again. I've considered how to handle Alistair - return him to the Kensingtons or have my men deal with him. Either way, Margaret can't stay."

Olivia shook her head gently. "No need for extremes. Just ensure she's no longer a threat. Let her live." The words triggered another violent coughing fit.
###Chapter 520

The moment Olivia collapsed, Liam's heart stopped. Without hesitation, he scooped her into his arms and rushed toward Mercy Hospital. As he passed Margaret Sinclair still sprawled on the floor, his gaze flickered over her for just a second before he kept moving.

Liam carried Olivia back to her private ward and immediately called for the doctors. Relief flooded through him when they confirmed she was stable. He vowed not to leave her side for the next few days, settling into the chair beside her bed like a sentinel. The entire night, he didn’t sleep a wink, his body rigid with tension as he watched over her. Olivia was exhausted, but sleep wouldn’t come—her mind was racing too fast.

She shifted restlessly under the sheets, and Liam immediately stood, adjusting the blankets around her with careful hands. His voice was rough with concern. "Are you in pain? Should I call the doctor back?"

Olivia shook her head with a faint smile. "Sit down," she murmured. "We need to talk."

Liam stiffened, sensing the weight of what was coming. Slowly, he sank back into the chair, his hands clenching into fists on his knees. He looked like a man bracing for a verdict.

Amusement flickered in Olivia’s eyes as she reached for his hand. After a brief hesitation, Liam extended it, his fingers trembling slightly. She guided his palm to rest against her stomach, letting the warmth of his touch linger there.

"It’s too early for you to feel anything," she said softly. "But when I was alone before, this was the only way I could sleep—just touching my stomach, knowing there was life inside me. When Isabelle was born, I almost didn’t make it. That moment… it was like she was the one keeping me alive, not the other way around." Her voice wavered. "This feeling… it’s just like when I was pregnant with her. How could I ever walk away from that?"

Liam opened his mouth, then closed it again, struggling for words. Finally, he spoke, his voice thick with worry. "I don’t want to see you in pain again. Another child isn’t worth your suffering. You and Isabelle—you’re everything to me. I don’t need anything else."

Olivia shook her head, her expression resolute. "No. I’m keeping this baby. It’s mine. I want this."

Liam looked stunned, his breath catching. He swallowed hard, clearly wrestling with her words. "But… you hated me. How can you—?"

Olivia cut him off gently. "Let’s leave the past where it belongs. This child shouldn’t carry the weight of our mistakes." She hesitated, then tightened her grip on his hand. "Maybe I shouldn’t say this, but… for our children, I want to give Isabelle and this baby a stable family." She took a deep breath. "So I’m willing to remarry you. But it would be in name only. If you find someone else—or if I do—we part ways peacefully."

Liam’s face was unreadable, his silence stretching between them. But his hand betrayed him, trembling against hers. Slowly, he leaned forward, pressing a kiss to her forehead. His voice was rough when he finally spoke. "Olivia… you’re not just saying this to convince me, are you?"

A quiet laugh escaped her. "You know I don’t joke about things like this."

The air between them shifted, heavy with unspoken promises.

###Chapter 521

Liam's lips curved into a tender smile as his fingers traced gentle circles over her swollen belly. "Thank you, darling. Your mother is finally willing to acknowledge me properly."

Olivia rolled her eyes, though affection warmed her voice. "Must you phrase it like that? You sound like some neglected husband."

"Can you blame me?" Liam countered, his tone laced with playful melancholy.

After being discharged from Mercy Hospital, Olivia returned home with Isabelle in tow. The moment they stepped inside, her gaze landed on Margaret. The once-proud woman was now a shadow of her former self, giggling vacantly at nothing in particular.

Sebastian moved to Olivia's side, his voice a hushed murmur. "She's harmless now."

Olivia studied Margaret with detached pity. The woman had orchestrated her own downfall. Had she not threatened them with Alistair, had she not forced her way into their lives—drugging both Olivia and Isabelle in her desperate power play—she might have lived comfortably in Newport.

But greed had sealed her fate.

Even with her darkest deeds exposed, the world would move on. People always did. If she behaved, she could still carve out some semblance of existence. Olivia turned to Winston. "Where's Grandpa? Does he know about Margaret's... condition?"

"Don't fret, Miss," Winston assured her. "Your grandfather may still dote on her, but as long as she remains here under supervision, all will be well." He hesitated before adding, "I've prepared a modest room for her near the garden. During our daily walks, your grandfather will see her. That should suffice."

Olivia exhaled, tension leaving her shoulders. "Good. Thank you."

With Margaret handled, Olivia's thoughts drifted back to Liam. She'd decided to remarry him, but there was no rush. She wasn't ready for Isabelle to call him "Dad" yet. Her daughter was perceptive but fragile—one misstep could wound her deeply.

Fate intervened when filming for the show commenced. Olivia seized the opportunity, inviting Liam to join them on set. Perhaps, she reasoned, time together would let them bond naturally.

Yet by the trip's end, Olivia realized her concerns had been unnecessary. Liam and Isabelle clicked effortlessly, their laughter ringing through the air as if they'd known each other forever.

Liam adored Isabelle with every fiber of his being. His eyes never strayed from her, as though she might vanish the moment he blinked. He hovered protectively, attending to her every whim for hours. Olivia massaged her temples, suppressing a fond sigh. "Liam, she isn't glass. You're spoiling her rotten."

He met her gaze, a soft smile playing on his lips. "I know. But I missed her first four years. Let me make up for lost time."

Olivia relented. With Liam watching over Isabelle so diligently, she could actually relax for once.

She opted against staying in the crew's arranged lodgings. Privacy was paramount with her family present. No one questioned her decision—not when she'd invested heavily in the production. To them, she was as much a sponsor as a cast member. As long as she adhered to the rules, they granted her leeway.

###Chapter 522

The trio settled into a charming countryside cottage. While not as luxurious as their penthouse back in Newport, the rustic charm made it ideal for their temporary home. Warm wooden beams and floral curtains created an inviting atmosphere that instantly put them at ease.

For little Isabelle, every moment was pure magic. Having never experienced rural life before, her boundless energy led her to investigate every nook and cranny. From chasing butterflies to collecting wildflowers, her laughter filled the air as she discovered the simple joys of country living.

Liam, ever the protective father, shadowed Isabelle's every move. "Watch your step, princess," he'd murmur whenever she ventured too close to the stone fence or muddy puddles. His watchful gaze never wavered, though his stern warnings were always softened by an affectionate smile.

While Isabelle napped, Olivia reviewed the show's participant list. Two civilians and two celebrities would join them - a university student and a tech startup founder representing ordinary life, while Olivia herself fell into the latter category. The celebrity lineup included Victoria Ellington, whose younger sister had once caught Donovan Kensington's eye.

Victoria possessed striking features that defied conventional beauty standards. Where others cultivated delicate femininity, she radiated bold confidence that commanded attention. Olivia could understand why Donovan had been so taken with her sister.

The second celebrity was an unfamiliar actress whose breathtaking beauty seemed almost unnatural. Olivia studied her photo, struck by an odd sense of recognition that hovered just beyond conscious memory. Before she could place the face, strong arms encircled her waist from behind.

"Time to call it a night," Liam murmured against her ear, his breath warm against her skin. "Isabelle finally wore herself out. I've drawn you a bath - Hazel will keep an ear out for her."

Olivia turned in his embrace, arching an eyebrow. "Since when did you become so domestic?"

Liam's fingers intertwined with hers as his voice dropped to a husky whisper. "Oh darling, this is just the beginning..." The smoldering look in his dark eyes left little to imagination.

With practiced ease, Olivia slipped free with a playful swat. "Dream on. I'm going to bed."

Emerging from her bath wrapped in a plush robe, Olivia found Liam sprawled dramatically across their bed. The exaggerated pout on his handsome face would've been comical if not for the very real heat in his gaze.

"Really?" She towel-dried her hair with an exasperated sigh. "What's your excuse tonight?"

Liam pointed solemnly toward the window where dark clouds gathered. "Storm's coming."

Olivia crossed her arms. "You haven't been afraid of thunder since you were six."

"True," Liam admitted, his expression turning unexpectedly serious. "But I remember someone who is."

Olivia's breath caught. After all these years, he still remembered her childhood fear. Isabelle, thankfully, shared none of her mother's storm anxiety. During thunderstorms, the little girl would curl protectively against Olivia, offering silent comfort. While the phobia had lessened over time, Olivia still struggled to sleep through severe weather. With filming starting tomorrow, the impending storm promised a restless night ahead.
###Chapter 523

Without speaking, Liam moved closer and carefully took the hairdryer from Olivia's hand, his fingers threading gently through her damp strands. "It's fine," he murmured. "I'll keep you company tonight. If it bothers you, I can stay by the window. The bed is all yours."

Olivia studied him, her voice hushed. "Don't be ridiculous. You'll freeze sleeping there, and then I'll have to nurse you back to health."

A soft smile played on Liam's lips. "Concerned about my wellbeing?"

Olivia scoffed but remained silent. After drying her hair, Liam effortlessly lifted her and settled her onto the bed. Keeping his promise, he made no advances, simply wrapping his arms around her, his hand rhythmically stroking her back in a comforting motion.

Olivia squirmed slightly, her cheeks flushing. "I'm not a child, Liam. You don't need to tuck me in like this."

Liam leaned closer, inhaling her familiar fragrance. He exhaled slowly, his voice barely above a whisper. "Every time I hold you like this, I keep thinking it might be another dream. I'm terrified that when I wake, I'll be back in that foreign prison cell, separated from you and Isabelle. The thought of you two was my only lifeline."

Drowsiness creeping in, Olivia asked sleepily, "What really happened overseas? You never told me... But I can imagine it was dangerous."

Liam didn't respond immediately. He simply watched as her breathing evened out, sleep claiming her. Pressing a featherlight kiss to her forehead, he whispered, "The past doesn't define us anymore."

For the first time in years, Olivia slept soundly through the raging storm outside.

At six the next morning, Olivia's alarm buzzed softly. She had intended to rise early, prepare breakfast, and let Isabelle sleep in. But when she entered the kitchen, she froze at the unexpected sight - Liam, clad in an apron, already busy at work.

Olivia stared in disbelief. Liam Blackwood, heir to the prestigious Blackwood dynasty of Crestwood, was cooking breakfast and cleaning her kitchen. The scene was so surreal that if anyone heard about it, they'd never believe it.

After breakfast, Olivia and Isabelle departed together. Olivia had anticipated potential hiccups, but she hadn't expected everything to derail so spectacularly on the first day. Due to a production error, Olivia had been given the wrong call time. Though she typically arrived early, this miscommunication resulted in her being twenty minutes late.

Upon arrival, a flustered crew member rushed over, beads of sweat on their forehead. "Our deepest apologies, Miss Kensington. We initially scheduled for the time we gave you, but there was a last-minute change. We updated everyone through a group chat, and I didn't realize you weren't included."

Olivia's eyebrows arched as she noticed three young individuals nearby. "Who created this group?" she inquired.

An employee quickly answered, "It was organized by Victoria Ellington. The group admin is another actress - Miranda Graves."
###Chapter 524

Olivia Sinclair was far from naive. Within moments, she detected the subtle tension in the air. It was their first day of filming, and none of the cast members had been properly introduced yet. While Olivia had managed to review the guest list beforehand due to her connections with the director, what about the others? Maybe it was just first-day jitters.

When the production crew discreetly asked if she needed clarification about the unfolding dynamics, Olivia shook her head with practiced grace. Asking questions now would appear unprofessional. The window for inquiries had closed. Besides, it seemed insignificant compared to the bigger picture. Hand in hand with little Isabelle, Olivia moved through the room, greeting each guest with genuine warmth.

Their arrival sparked smiles across the room, though not all expressions reflected genuine delight. Victoria Ellington and Miranda Graves stood apart, their stiff postures and guarded expressions setting them apart from the others. When Olivia's gaze landed on Miranda, recognition flashed in her eyes. Miranda was the young woman Olivia had encountered during her visit to the Montgomery estate with Alexander. At the time, Olivia had tried to offer sincere advice, but Miranda remained convinced she'd been deliberately deceived. That unfortunate encounter had left Olivia with reservations about Miranda's character.

Miranda recognized Olivia immediately and instinctively retreated behind Victoria, as if seeking protection. Victoria merely arched a perfectly sculpted eyebrow and struck a pose that radiated superiority, her protective stance toward Miranda speaking volumes about their alliance.

A bright-eyed college student approached Olivia with an enthusiastic greeting. "You must be the brilliant businesswoman everyone's buzzing about online. The media doesn't do your beauty justice. I've been following your negotiations with Sinclair Enterprises - your strategic moves are absolutely masterful."

The young woman had an infectious energy, with rosy cheeks and sparkling eyes that held a childlike wonder. When she smiled, deep dimples appeared, instantly brightening the atmosphere around her.

Flattered by the genuine compliment, Olivia returned the smile. "The media tends to exaggerate. It's lovely to meet you in person."

The girl's eyes widened in surprise. "I didn't expect you to be so down-to-earth! I'm Charlotte Bennett, a sophomore at Crestwood University. I'm here for the incredible learning opportunity. Everyone here is so accomplished - you're barely older than me, yet you've achieved so much!"

Charlotte's enthusiasm bubbled over as she continued showering the group with compliments. Olivia chuckled. "I'm actually quite a bit older than you look. I have a daughter."

"Isabelle, come say hello to everyone." Isabelle approached with a radiant smile, greeting each person with perfect manners.

Victoria, who had maintained a cool distance until now, visibly softened and gently brushed Isabelle's cheek with her fingertips. Miranda, however, remained silent, shrinking further behind Victoria.

Charlotte couldn't contain her excitement as she scooped Isabelle into an enthusiastic hug. "Oh my stars! You're absolutely precious! I've never seen such an adorable little angel. You're simply delightful!"

Completely at ease with the attention, Isabelle giggled in Charlotte's embrace. "When I grow up, I want to be famous like you! I'll light up the entertainment world and be as glamorous as you are."

Charlotte laughed and gently corrected her. "Oh sweetheart, I'm not famous yet! First focus on your studies. I'm at Crestwood University - maybe you'll join me there someday."
###Chapter 525

Olivia's face brightened with maternal pride as Isabelle nodded enthusiastically. The tender moment shattered when a venomous voice sliced through the air. "Must be wonderful having generational wealth. Just waltz into Hollywood like you own it while the rest of us claw our way up from nothing."

The temperature seemed to drop ten degrees as Olivia's head snapped up. Her glacial stare pinned Miranda Graves, who'd been lurking behind Victoria Ellington. Miranda's words dripped with performative martyrdom, her delicate features arranged in practiced victimhood.

Olivia's jaw tightened. Every syllable was being broadcast to millions. Isabelle's innocent comment about wanting to act had been twisted into some nefarious plot. Miranda's implication was clear - the Sinclairs were buying their way into the industry at others' expense.

The live chat exploded with Miranda's sycophants:

"Queen Miranda speaking truth to power!"

"Another trust fund baby stealing opportunities from real talent."

"At least Miranda earned her success through actual skill."

"That poor child doesn't stand a chance with that mother."

"Notice how Miranda's the only one brave enough to call out privilege?"

"Everyone knows Miranda's the most authentic person in Hollywood."

The barrage of comments flashed across the massive studio screens. Isabelle's lower lip trembled as she absorbed the sudden hostility. Though young, she understood enough to know people were being cruel about her mother.

Charlotte Bennett moved closer, murmuring, "She's just a little girl. This is completely unnecessary."

Miranda stepped forward with theatrical solemnity. "Children's words reflect their upbringing. We must hold parents accountable." Her gaze slid to Olivia, heavy with manufactured concern. "Ms. Sinclair, I say this as someone who cares - filling a child's head with dreams of fame is irresponsible. There appear to be... concerning gaps in her moral education."

Isabelle's small hands balled into fists. Without warning, she gave Miranda's leg a light push. "Don't talk about Mommy like that!"

The contact was barely noticeable, yet Miranda collapsed like she'd been struck by a truck. She landed in an undignified heap, knees scraping the floor as she cried out in exaggerated pain. Crew members rushed forward in a flurry of manufactured concern.

The studio erupted into chaos.

Cameras zoomed in on Miranda's "injuries."

Producers whispered frantically into headsets.

And through it all, Olivia stood perfectly still, her expression unreadable as a winter lake.
###Chapter 526

The cameras kept rolling despite the sudden commotion. Victoria Ellington, who stood nearest to Miranda Graves, immediately noticed the disturbance and rushed to assist her. "Miranda, are you hurt? Oh heavens, you're bleeding! Does it pain you terribly?"

Even if Victoria was merely performing for the cameras, her concern appeared utterly genuine. Tears welled in her expressive eyes, a perfect blend of distress and maternal worry that played beautifully on screen.

Online viewers erupted in outrage against Olivia Sinclair and little Isabelle.

"What kind of monster child is this? Miranda was only speaking the truth and trying to protect that brat! Why would she push her like that?"

"I had such high hopes for this show, but that toxic mother-daughter duo is ruining everything. Producers - if you want ratings, get rid of them immediately!"

"Exactly! They're poison. Remove them now before they destroy the entire program!"

"Someone please make that wretched pair leave! I can't bear watching another second of their nonsense."

"Did you see the electric chemistry between Miranda and Victoria though? They're perfectly matched in beauty and screen presence."

Olivia remained silent, her icy gaze locked onto the director. She understood the production needed drama for ratings, but harming Isabelle crossed every line. From the crew's vantage point, it was painfully obvious Miranda had staged her fall.

The director cleared his throat awkwardly. "This was clearly an accident. Miranda slipped on a loose stone. We all witnessed it. How could a four-year-old possibly possess that kind of strength?" Miranda hadn't anticipated the crew defending Olivia. A flicker of guilt crossed her features before she schooled them into perfect wounded innocence. With assistance from the surrounding crowd, she rose gracefully, catching the director's subtle warning glance.

Turning toward the cameras, Miranda adopted a martyr's expression. "It was simply an unfortunate accident. Please don't blame Miss Sinclair or her precious daughter. I brought this upon myself through my own carelessness." As she spoke, Miranda shot Olivia a sideways glance that was anything but innocent.

The actress pretended to be diffusing tension, but her carefully chosen words subtly implied Olivia had bullied her. Olivia merely watched the performance with amusement. She hadn't revealed what transpired at the last gala because the timing wasn't right.

Olivia's original plan had been simple - a relaxing outing with Isabelle while casually getting closer to Victoria. She hadn't accounted for Miranda's relentless provocations.

The veiled hostility in Miranda's gaze didn't escape Olivia's notice. A cold smile curved her lips while her eyes remained glacial. This time, Miranda's fear was unmistakably genuine as she shrank from Olivia's arctic stare. Though some audience members continued grumbling, the immediate outrage had subsided after Miranda's "gracious" explanation.

The production team had discreetly pulled Miranda aside earlier, reminding her that Olivia had invested substantial capital into the program. Crossing the Sinclair heiress would be unwise. Miranda's agent had reinforced this, pointing out that the exposure from this show could land her lucrative endorsement deals. Sinclair Enterprises, though newly prominent, maintained close ties with the powerful Montgomery Group and possessed formidable marketing resources. Securing a Sinclair endorsement could catapult Miranda's career to new heights. Clenching her jaw, Miranda swallowed her pride - for now. The game wasn't over yet.
###Chapter 527

Miranda Graves shot a venomous glare at Olivia and Isabelle, her hostility palpable. The memory of humiliating herself at the Kensington manor still burned fresh, and she blamed Olivia entirely. Behind Olivia's elegant facade, Miranda saw nothing but a cunning manipulator.

Strangely enough, Miranda had formed an instant connection with Victoria Ellington despite their recent acquaintance. With Victoria's influence, Miranda was certain stardom was within reach. Once she achieved fame, the exclusive circles of Crestwood would finally open their doors to her. Her beauty alone guaranteed that much.

As the production crew lightened the mood, tensions gradually eased. Miranda even attempted polite conversation with Isabelle. Olivia realized provoking Miranda had been unwise. Though her dislike remained, she maintained a perfect smile.

Charlotte Bennett leaned closer to Olivia, whispering, "Miss Kensington, there seems to be some history between you and Miranda. Did something happen between you two?"

Olivia responded with an enigmatic smile. "You're quite observant."

Charlotte's eyes sparkled with pride. "I studied psychology at university. These things are obvious to me. Even initial dislike wouldn't explain such intensity. There's clearly more to this story. How did you cross her? She might not be A-list yet, but rumors say she's connected to a powerful Crestwood magnate."

Olivia's interest immediately sharpened. "A Crestwood magnate? Who?" Aside from Liam Blackwood in the past, she couldn't imagine anyone else fitting that description.

Charlotte shook her head helplessly. "No idea. People like us would never have access to that information."

Olivia nodded thoughtfully. Now she understood Miranda's boldness - someone influential was pulling strings behind the scenes. The mystery only deepened her curiosity. Who was this shadowy benefactor supporting Miranda?

Following the earlier confrontation, Olivia and Isabelle had to stay with the production team. As they traveled through the countryside, both marveled at the breathtaking landscapes. The serene scenery lifted everyone's spirits, especially Isabelle's.

Though young and excitable, Isabelle managed to temper her enthusiasm. Charlotte took an immediate liking to the girl, engaging in playful banter. Isabelle's charm worked like magic, brightening the atmosphere. Even the audience comments reflected this shift.

"This little angel is absolutely precious. I just want to squeeze those rosy cheeks!"

"Careful, she might bite. That firecracker is probably just acting sweet for the cameras."

"Why so cruel to a child? The director already clarified everything. Miranda admitted she slipped on a rock. No need for such venom toward a little girl."

"Can we just appreciate the gorgeous scenery? All the guests are stunning anyway."

After the long journey, Isabelle had fallen asleep in Charlotte's arms. Olivia moved to take her, but Charlotte gently refused, having grown quite attached to the sleeping child.
###Chapter 528

The photographer quickly captured several shots of Isabelle sleeping peacefully, her delicate features illuminated by the soft lighting. Viewers watching the live stream collectively cooed at the angelic sight.

Within the hour, their vehicle pulled up to a weathered three-story building. The production team had clearly gone all out for authenticity - the structure appeared decades old with peeling paint and grime-covered windows. Only three bedrooms were available: two singles and one double.

Everyone secretly coveted the private rooms. Charlotte Bennett, ever the gracious one, immediately volunteered for the shared space. "Would anyone like to room with me?" she asked with a warm smile.

The online comments exploded with praise:
"What an absolute sweetheart! Her kindness just radiates through the screen."
"I attend Westfield University with Charlotte. She's a psychology major and consistently ranks top of our class - brilliant and beautiful!"

Miranda Graves' expression soured watching Charlotte steal the spotlight. Clearing her throat dramatically, Miranda stepped forward. "I propose we draw lots for complete fairness. Consistency matters in group dynamics. Making exceptions now will only cause problems later." She gave Charlotte a patronizing look. "I appreciate your good intentions, but you clearly lack experience in these situations. Don't worry, we'll guide you."

Charlotte's smile faltered momentarily at Miranda's condescending tone before she regained her composure. The realization struck her sharply - while Miranda didn't have many fans, her small following was rabidly devoted. As a mere college student, Charlotte had no desire to provoke their wrath.

As expected, the audience praised Miranda's "impartial" suggestion. Basking in the attention, Miranda turned to Victoria Ellington with a simpering smile. "Victoria, what do you think of my idea?"

Victoria reached out to affectionately ruffle Miranda's hair. "Perfect solution." Miranda practically glowed at the praise.

The live chat went wild. Victoria's star power naturally drew attention, and her apparent favoritism toward Miranda made viewers curious about the lesser-known actress. This exposure would undoubtedly boost Miranda's profile.

Olivia Sinclair observed the interaction with growing confusion. According to her team's research, Victoria and Miranda had never met before this show. Why would an A-lister like Victoria, who famously stood up to Donovan Kensington, suddenly cozy up to a nobody like Miranda? There had to be more to this story.

The room assignments were announced swiftly: Olivia would share the double with Miranda, while Charlotte and Victoria each got private rooms.

A shadow crossed everyone's faces at the results. Miranda bit her lip, eyes suddenly glistening with unshed tears. Her push for "fairness" had been purely for show - the thought of being trapped with Olivia was unbearable.
###Chapter 529

If it were just herself, Olivia wouldn't have minded this arrangement. But she had to think of Isabelle. What if Miranda tried something? Olivia's protective instincts flared as she debated asking Liam to take Isabelle somewhere safer.

In an unexpected gesture, Miranda approached Olivia, her smile strained as she spoke through clenched teeth. "Miss Kensington, let's try to coexist civilly," Miranda said, her voice dripping with false sweetness. "I know you're not thrilled about rooming with me either, but we're stuck together for this week. Let's forget past misunderstandings. I'm willing to let bygones be bygones, provided you and your daughter don't cause any disturbances."

Olivia's grip tightened around Isabelle's small hand. Miranda's words, masquerading as peace offerings, only made her more wary. Was Miranda implying they were the troublemakers here? Hadn't Miranda been the one harassing them first?

Murmurs of admiration for Miranda's supposed generosity rippled through the gathered crowd.

"Honestly, I've never seen anyone as forgiving as Miranda. She's practically a saint."

"True. But I worry for her. That mother-daughter pair might try something when the cameras aren't rolling."

"Don't be ridiculous! The production team wouldn't allow that."

"You're so naive! Olivia paid a fortune to get on this show. She wasn't even on the original roster. Makes you wonder what strings she pulled."

Olivia felt the sting of their words but remained silent. She'd only joined the program for Isabelle's sake. Forcing a smile, she reached for Miranda's hand, though her eyes remained guarded. "Why would we cause trouble? Isabelle and I despise drama. There are two beds - you're welcome to the larger one. If it makes you more comfortable, I'll even hang a divider between us. And if children bother you, I'll ensure Isabelle stays out of your way."

Miranda blinked in surprise at Olivia's sudden graciousness. "Oh no, you should take the bigger bed with your daughter. That's only proper."

Olivia countered immediately, "If I did that, people might claim we forced you into the smaller bed. Then we'd never hear the end of it."

Her blunt statement created an awkward silence. Miranda's eyes welled with sudden tears. "Miss Kensington, you can't paint me as the villain here."

Victoria moved to comfort Miranda, shooting Olivia a disapproving look. "Must you be so cruel? Miranda genuinely wants peace."

Olivia's musical laughter cut through the tension. Her striking beauty made everyone else fade into the background. "How dramatic! Miss Graves and I were just playing. I didn't realize she'd take it so seriously. My mistake - I should've known better. Earlier, I saw her joking with Isabelle, pretending to fall and claiming my daughter pushed her. I assumed she enjoyed such playful banter."
###Chapter 530

The atmosphere among the spectators turned icy. Olivia's carefully worded remarks about Miranda carried an undercurrent of hostility beneath their polite surface, making everyone uncomfortable.

Online opinions split sharply.

"Olivia was just being playful. Miranda's overreacting again. She's cried twice already during this show. It's getting tiresome."

"Exactly! This is a variety show, not a therapy session. No one's attacking her, yet she keeps breaking down."

"Are you blind? Olivia's sarcasm was dripping. Her daughter wronged Miranda, and even after Miranda extended an olive branch, she gets mocked. Anyone would feel hurt in her position."

The digital battlefield reignited. As Olivia meticulously adjusted the fabric divider between their beds, she casually suggested, "Perhaps we should install surveillance in the room. For Miss Prescott's safety, of course. If anything happens, we'll have evidence to protect the innocent." She lingered pointedly on the word "innocent."

Previously, Miranda had tried framing Isabelle. Now Olivia was countering. After the commotion settled, Olivia guided Isabelle back to their shared space. The new curtain created a clean partition, their modest bed nestled by the window. Though cramped, it provided enough room for mother and daughter.

Regret gnawed at Olivia. Had she known this would distress Isabelle, she never would have brought her along. Her thoughts scattered when the door hinges squeaked.

Victoria and Miranda entered quietly. Miranda's sniffles and puffy eyes betrayed her recent breakdown. Victoria murmured soothing words, her voice calm yet strained.

Miranda suddenly clutched Victoria's wrist, her voice trembling. "Victoria, please don't go. Stay with me a little longer."

Victoria exhaled heavily. "Miranda, I need to unpack. I promise I'll come back after, alright?"

Miranda didn't answer, her watery gaze fixed on the curtain, lips quivering with fresh indignation. "The producers said they're adding cameras," she muttered. "What will people think when they see this divider?"

Though whispered, Olivia caught every word. Her jaw tightened. She'd installed the curtain precisely because of Miranda's dramatics. Any incident would inevitably become Olivia's fault in Miranda's narrative.

Isabelle stirred beside her, groaning. "Mommy, the noise! I can't sleep!" Miranda's weeping, though subdued, carried an irritating shrillness - like a persistent mosquito in the night.

Before Olivia could respond, Miranda's sobs escalated dramatically. Then came the sound of hurried footsteps rushing down the corridor toward them.
